0.title: Once you've invested in youngsters, you can't leave them to be barbecued: Karim
0.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has supported the selection of Avesh Khan ahead of Mohammad Shami for the upcoming Asia Cup. "I feel once you have invested in youngsters like Avesh Khan, you possibly can't leave them out to be barbecued," he stated. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan are the only pacers in the squad.

1.title: Ukraine war must end with liberation of Crimea: Prez Zelenskyy
1.article_body: The war in Ukraine began with Crimea and must end with its liberation, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. "Russia has turned our peninsula, which has always been...one of the best places in Europe, into one of the most dangerous places," he added. Zelenskyy's comments came hours after a string of explosions hit a Russian airbase in Crimea, killing one person.

2.title: Awareness against PM Modi spreading among people of country: RJD leader
2.article_body: RJD National General Secretary Shyam Rajak on Wednesday said, "Awareness against PM Narendra Modi is spreading among the people of the country." His statement came amid ongoing Bihar political crisis. "More than 10 lakh people would be employed...There is a flicker of hope for the people who have been concerned about the growing communalism," he added.

3.title: You only have to say 'Yes sir', implement whatever ministers say: Gadkari to bureaucrats
3.article_body: Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said, "I always tell the officers (bureaucrats), that the government will not work according to what you say." "You only have to say 'Yes sir'. You have to implement whatever we (ministers) are saying, government will work according to us," Gadkari further said.

4.title: Bhima-Koregaon accused Varavara Rao gets regular bail on medical grounds
4.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday granted regular bail to activist and poet Varavara Rao, an accused in the 2018 Bhima-Koregaon case, "purely on medical grounds". Rao shall not leave the jurisdiction of the concerned trial court without permission, SC directed. He shall not misuse his liberty and he shall not be in touch with any witnesses, SC further said.

5.title: IMD issues orange alert for Pune, 4 other Maha districts for Wednesday
5.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange' alert for Pune, Satara, Raigad, Ratnagiri and Palghar districts for Wednesday, stating that heavy rainfall is likely over parts of central Maharashtra and Vidarbha. It has also issued a 'yellow' alert for the five districts for Thursday. Pune recorded 23.2 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, IMD said on Wednesday.

6.title: WazirX trading volume declines by over 54% amid ownership controversy, ED probe
6.article_body: WazirX, which has been in a clash with Binance over its ownership and is facing a probe by the Enforcement Directorate, has seen its trading volume decline by over 54% over the last five days. Last year, it traded a volume of $43 billion. Meanwhile, WazirX also requested users to not panic and assured them of their funds' safety.

7.title: It's 'ghar wapasi' of 2017-2020 mandate: Manoj Jha on RJD-JD(U) alliance
7.article_body: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha reacted to his party's decision to form government in Bihar in alliance with JD(U) and said, "It's not only a government that'll take oath, it's 'ghar wapasi' of 2017-2020 mandate." "It's very important, especially in an era where BJP has decided to mangle democratic values - that only they would remain," Jha said.

8.title: Do you have any ideology?: Chirag Paswan asks Nitish Kumar
8.article_body: Amid ongoing political situation in Bihar, LJP’s National President Chirag Paswan said Nitish Kumar, who resigned as CM of Bihar, has once again insulted the people’s mandate. "Is it a joke? At one time you go with somebody...other time with someone else…Do you have any ideology or not?" Paswan asked. "JD(U) will get zero seats in next election," he stated.

9.title: 4in1 flu vaccination can help protect children from H1N1: Experts
9.article_body: Recent reports suggest a rising trend in Swine Flu (H1N1) cases in cities across India. Children younger than 5 years in age are at up to 7 times higher risk of getting hospitalised. "Pediatricians advise 4in1 flu vaccination annually along with good hand hygiene and social distancing for children from 6 months to 5 years," said Dr Upendra Kinjawadekar.

10.title: If any girl tells a boy she wants to have sex, she is doing 'dhanda': Mukesh Khanna
10.article_body: Actor Mukesh Khanna is being criticised for his comments in a video on his YouTube channel, where he said, "If any girl tells a boy that she wants to have sex with him, then she is not a girl, she is doing 'dhanda' (business)." He added, "Because a decent girl belonging to a civilised society would never say such things."

11.title: Was told you're not a woman enough if you're not voluptuous: Sonali
11.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre revealed that she was body-shamed for being skinny in the 90s. "Being skinny was definitely not the standard of beauty, so voluptuousness was the standard of beauty," she said. Sonali added, "I was told you were just not a woman enough if you were not voluptuous, you know which it shouldn't be."

12.title: Partha said he will write about his life in prison, sought pen and paper: Official
12.article_body: Ex-Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested in alleged job scam case, sought paper and a pen on Monday saying he will write about his life, officials said. Chatterjee has also requested for a few books on politics, economics, and law and he is being provided newspapers but he has so far shown no interest in it, the officials added.

13.title: I am the 'most nepotistic' filmmaker in India: Anurag Kashyap
13.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap, who's directed movies like 'Black Friday', 'Bombay Talkies' as well as the 'Gangs of Wasseypur' film franchise said he is the "most nepotistic" filmmaker in India. "I need to know my people because I trust them...I won't hire somebody...I don't know," added Anurag. Actress Kangana Ranaut had earlier termed director Karan Johar as the flag-bearer of nepotism.

14.title: If I've hurt anyone, I regret it: Aamir Khan on boycott 'Laal Singh Chaddha' trend
14.article_body: Speaking on the controversy around his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and calls on social media to boycott it, actor Aamir Khan on Tuesday said, "If I have hurt anyone by any means, I regret it." He added, "I don't want to hurt anyone. If someone doesn't want to watch the film, I'd respect their sentiment."

15.title: Users registered only after completion of KYC: WazirX in statement amid ED probe
15.article_body: WazirX on behalf of its parent company Zanmai Labs released a statement amid a clash with Binance and ED freezing its assets. It said, "Users are signed up on WazirX...after they complete the KYC process...ED appears to be investigating the transactions of certain users...Zanmai Labs...has no affiliation with such users and is unaware of the purpose of their transactions."

16.title: I can't even say the word 'relationship' well, how can I be in one?: Vijay
16.article_body: After actress Sara Ali Khan recently expressed her desire to date actor Vijay Deverakonda, the actor said, "I can't even say the word 'relationship' well. How can I be in one?" "I texted Sara. It's...sweet of her to have said that," added Vijay. "I love how you say 'Deverakonda'. Cutest," Vijay had earlier reacted to Sara's statement on Instagram.

17.title: Lenovo reports slowest revenue growth in 9 quarters
17.article_body: China's Lenovo Group has reported flat revenue for the April to June quarter, its lowest result in nine quarters. The world's biggest maker of personal computers reported the slowest revenue growth when a number of Chinese cities faced COVID-19 lockdowns. During the period, total revenue was $16.96 billion, up 0.2% from the same quarter a year ago.

18.title: Roblox shares fall 15% as company posts lower net bookings in Q2
18.article_body: Online gaming platform Roblox Corporation posted lower net bookings of $639.9 million in the second quarter as against $665.5 million in the year-ago period amid reports of the online gaming industry facing a slump as the COVID-19 pandemic restrictions are easing. Roblox shares fell 15% in after-hours trading on Tuesday and its stock's value has declined over 50% this year.

19.title: Intel & PC manufacturers partner to co-engineer premium laptops
19.article_body: Intel announced its partnership with the top PC manufacturers to co-engineer a line-up of premium thin, light, & stylish Intel®️ Evo™️ laptops. As per Intel, these laptops deliver premium features including instant wake, nearly 3X faster Wi-Fi speeds, fast-charging, long-lasting battery, and intelligent collaboration features like dynamic noise cancellation. Find more details on www.intel.com/evo

20.title: Egyptian singer with two wives and 4 children proposed me: Urvashi Rautela
20.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela in an interview said, "I have dealt with so many proposals. But there was one which came from someone, which could have led to a lot of cultural differences." She revealed that an Egyptian singer who has two wives and four children had proposed her. Urvashi further said that she had met the singer in Dubai.

21.title: No CNG sale in Delhi today over non-reimbursement of electricity bills of pumps
21.article_body: Delhi Petrol Dealers Association said that there will not be any CNG sale in the city on Wednesday and CNG pumps will be closed from 6 am to 10 pm. It has called for a protest against the non-reimbursement of electricity bills of CNG pumps by Indraprastha Gas Limited. The non-reimbursement is causing huge losses every day, pump dealers said.

22.title: No 'Operation Lotus' in Bihar, all done in civilised & low-cost way: Jairam
22.article_body: Congress’ Jairam Ramesh reacted to the political situation in Bihar saying, "Bihar was no 'Operation Lotus'." "No cash caught. No ED raids. No Assam CM. No resort travel. All done in characteristic Bihar style, civilised and low-cost," Ramesh tweeted. "CM gets support of largest party...In Maharashtra, BJP engineered defections. In Bihar, BJP was rejected and ejected," he added.

23.title: Cuba's worst ever fire brought under control after burning for 5 days
23.article_body: A fire that destroyed Cuba's main fuel storage facility in Matanzas has been brought under control after five days. About 40% of the facility has been destroyed in what officials said was the worst fire in its history. The fire, which also caused massive blackouts, was triggered when lightning struck one of the tanks at the storage facility last Friday.

24.title: Punjab and Haryana HC grants bail to SAD's Bikram Majithia in NDPS case
24.article_body: Punjab and Haryana HC has granted bail to Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) MLA Bikram Singh Majithia in a case registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985. The present case is "blatantly political in nature", Majithia told HC in his bail plea. This comes after the Supreme Court on May 11 refused to entertain the bail plea.

25.title: Serena is at the same level as Michael Jordan, LeBron James: McEnroe
25.article_body: Reacting to 23-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams announcing her retirement from tennis, ex-world number one tennis player John McEnroe said Serena is at the same level as Michael Jordan and LeBron James. "She's...one of the...greatest athletes in the history of any sport," he added. "Anyone that saw...'King Richard'...realises...where she's now is unbelievable," stated McEnroe.

26.title: We're living in strange times; 2 yrs later, Sushant trends every day: Kashyap
26.article_body: Anurag Kashyap opened up about the boycott culture and said these are strange times, where everything is to be boycotted. "We are living in very strange times. Two years later, Sushant Singh Rajput still trends every day," Kashyap added. The filmmaker further said India has a boycott culture now and added, "If you're not being boycotted, then you don't matter."

27.title: Thinking too much about 24th Slam didn't help: Serena Williams
27.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has said that thinking "too much" about surpassing Margaret Court's all-time record of 24 Grand Slam titles didn't help her. "I'd be lying if I said I didn't want that record," she added. Serena has announced that she will retire from tennis following US Open 2022.

28.title: I never let this 'Oh God, I'm playing only one format' feeling inside: Dhawan
28.article_body: Talking about his current role in Team India, Shikhar Dhawan has said, "Till the time I'm playing for India, I'd like to be an asset and not a liability." He added, "I never let this feeling creep into my system that, 'Oh God, I'm playing only one format'...If I'm playing...after a gap...it always gives me a chance to remain fresh."

29.title: Monkeys under attack in Brazil amid rising monkeypox cases
29.article_body: The World Health Organization decried increasing attacks on monkeys in Brazil amid a rise in monkeypox cases. "What people need to know is that...transmission we're seeing is happening between humans," WHO's spokeswoman Margaret Harris said. This comes after Brazilian news website, G1, on Sunday reported that around 10 monkeys were poisoned in less than a week in Sao Paulo state.

30.title: 51-yr-old Afghan charged in killing of 2 Muslim men in US' Albuquerque
30.article_body: A 51-year-old man from Afghanistan has been charged with the murders of two Muslim men in US' Albuquerque and has been identified as a prime suspect in other killings. The exact nature of the relationship between Muhammad Syed and victims remains unknown. Police said it has not been ascertained whether the deaths are hate crimes or serial killings or both.

31.title: Bill to give Afghans path to citizenship introduced in US Congress
31.article_body: Bipartisan legislation has been introduced in both houses of US Congress which aims to pave the path for Afghan evacuees in the US to gain American citizenship. As many as 76,000 Afghans evacuated in last year's operation entered the US on humanitarian parole. The bill also aims to extend Special Immigration Visas (SIV) to women who served in counterterrorism teams.

32.title: Oil prices fall after data shows US crude inventories rising
32.article_body: Oil prices fell on Wednesday after industry data showed that US crude inventories had risen by about 2.2 million barrels for the week ended August 5. Brent crude futures declined by 6 cents to $96.25 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures fell by 16 cents to $90.34 a barrel. On Tuesday, oil prices settled slightly lower.

33.title: We fixed it: Twitter rolls back internal systems change after partial outage
33.article_body: After thousands of users reported an outage of Twitter on Tuesday, the company on Wednesday announced that the issue was fixed and that it had "made an internal systems change that didn't go as planned". According to Downdetector, users began facing issues around 2 pm EDT on Tuesday (around 11:30 pm in India).

34.title: Man out on bail in molestation case shoots victim's father dead in UP
34.article_body: A 21-year-old man, out on bail in a molestation case, allegedly shot dead the victim's father in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur, police said. The man, along with his father, uncle and a friend have been booked. He was arrested in 2021 after a 17-year-old girl had alleged he had sexually assaulted her when she was alone in her house, police added.

35.title: It's making my life easier: Vijay on wearing slippers to promote 'Liger'
35.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda opened up about wearing slippers during the promotions of his film 'Liger'. "See, 30 days I have to promote the film and then every day I have to look for shoes and clothes and it will take forever," he said. He added that he has bought "great" slippers and it is making his life easier.

36.title: US-based firm FCTRY raises $120,000 to make Zelenskyy action figure
36.article_body: US-based product design company FCTRY will make an action figure of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The company launched a campaign to fund production and reached its $30,000 goal in three hours and has so far raised over $120,000. A Seattle-based artist moulded 6-inch tall clay prototype of the action figure and its plastic version will be mass produced in China.

37.title: Microsoft to mark 15 years OneDrive with new features, design
37.article_body: To mark OneDrive's 15th anniversary, Microsoft has come up with a new landing page called OneDrive Home. It contains a list of user files, organised according to how recently they were accessed, which is quite similar to the online version of the Office. The Verge has quoted Microsoft as saying that OneDrive Home would be available in "the coming months".

38.title: One leader can't face all challenges before this country: RSS chief
38.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said that one leader cannot face all the challenges before this country and a single organisation or party cannot bring about change. "Change takes place when the common man stands up for it," Bhagwat added. "All things take place through a change in society and the RSS is organising society," he stated.

39.title: BMC to widen drains in Andheri subway to avoid waterlogging
39.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken a project of widening drains at Andheri (West) at an estimated cost of ₹100 crore, which will take 18 months to complete. "The stormwater drain on the western side is not enough to take more quantity of water at a time. So with each rain, the subway gets flooded," a BMC official said.

40.title: This is what Bihar has done: RJD on PM Modi's 2017 tweet on state
40.article_body: RJD, which formed an alliance with JD(U), after Nitish Kumar broke his ties with BJP, shared PM Modi's 2017 tweet on Bihar in which he said that the state needs to fight against corruption for country's bright future. Sharing PM's tweet, RJD wrote, "Yes sir, this is exactly what Bihar has done...This is the demand of the country today."

41.title: Alia is a brave actress, chose to embrace motherhood at young age: Kareena
41.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan was asked if she has advice for Alia Bhatt facing comments on her pregnancy. To this, she replied that Alia doesn't need advice and added the 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' actress is the finest actress of the decade. "For her to be embracing motherhood, you know, at such a young age...She is such a brave actress," Kareena added.

42.title: We play a lot of cricket, so we want to create our bench strength: Rohit
42.article_body: Talking about frequent changes in India's squads, captain Rohit Sharma said they are trying to create their bench strength to make sure that the team's future is in "safe hands". "We play lot of cricket, so there will be injuries and workload management...But it gives our bench strength to go and play the game," added Rohit.

43.title: Use public transport: B'luru Traffic Police to Lalbagh Flower Show visitors
43.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police urged the visitors to Lalbagh Botanical Garden's Independence Day Flower Show to use public transport. "There is a metro station in Lalbagh west gate...a BMTC bus stand at Lalbagh main gate. Shantinagar bus stand and Siddapura bus stand are also available for commuters," police said. Lalbagh Flower Show is being held from August 5 to August 15.

44.title: TMC won't be in power in West Bengal by December: Suvendu Adhikari
44.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday claimed that the TMC government will "cease to exist" by December in West Bengal. "Wait for a few months...Mark my words, by December this year, TMC will not be in power in West Bengal. The Assembly poll and parliamentary elections will be held simultaneously in 2024 in West Bengal," Adhikari added.

45.title: New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult gives up his central contract
45.article_body: New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult, the current world number one ODI bowler, has given up his central contract. "Ultimately...this decision is about my wife Gert and our three young boys," the 33-year-old said. "I still have a big desire to represent my country...However, I respect the fact that not having a national contract will affect my selection chances," he added.

46.title: India reports 16,047 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 26% more than yesterday
46.article_body: India has reported 16,047 new COVID-19 cases and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, including six reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,28,261, while the daily positivity rate went up to 4.94%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,826.

47.title: 42-yr-old mother, 24-yr-old son clear Kerala Public Service Commission exam
47.article_body: A 42-year-old woman named Bindu and her 24-year-old son have cleared Kerala Public Service Commission (PSC) examination together. Bindu cleared the Last Grade Servants (LGS) exam with a rank of 92, and Vivek cleared the Lower Divisional Clerk (LDC) exam with a rank of 38, PTI reported. "We both studied together but never thought that we'll qualify together," said Vivek.

48.title: iRobot announced 10% job cuts the same day as Amazon declared firm's acquisition
48.article_body: The day Amazon announced its acquisition of iRobot for about $1.7 billion, the latter revealed its plans to cut 140 jobs, nearly 10% of its workforce. The disclosure was made in its quarterly earnings report. Meanwhile, iRobot also clarified that the layoffs were not a result of the Amazon deal and that the latter was not involved in this decision.

49.title: Sold Tesla shares to avoid emergency sale if Twitter forces deal closure: Musk
49.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 7.92 million shares of Tesla worth around $6.9 billion. Tweeting about this, he wrote, "In the (hopefully unlikely) event that Twitter forces this deal to close and some equity partners don't come through, it is important to avoid an emergency sale of Tesla stock." Notably, he sold Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion in April.

50.title: Karthik will be 'very unhappy' with his dismissal: Ojha on 5th T20I vs WI
50.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik will be "very unhappy" with himself, following his dismissal in the fifth T20I against West Indies. "When you can score with a straight bat, why do you have to try something like this? It was such a good chance for him," added Ojha. Karthik was dismissed for 12 runs off 9 balls.

51.title: Sensex jumps 10 points to 58,863, Nifty crosses 17,500 in opening trade
51.article_body: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Wednesday with Sensex and Nifty surging 10.92 points and 7.90 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 58,863.99 points and Nifty at 17,533. Nestle India, Sun Pharma, Bharti Airtel and Power Grid Corp were among the major gainers on the BSE Sensex, while ITC, HDFC Bank, Asian Paints, Axis Bank and Titan slipped.

52.title: What is the Langya virus that has been detected in China?
52.article_body: The Langya virus, which has been detected in China, was predominantly found in small mole-like mammals called shrews, according to a study in The New England Journal of Medicine. It was detected during surveillance of patients with a recent history of animal exposure. According to the study, patients with pneumonia had higher viral loads than those without pneumonia.

53.title: ODI cricket is an art and still has the charm, I love playing it: Dhawan
53.article_body: Amid talks over the future of ODI cricket, Team India batter Shikhar Dhawan has said the format is an art and still has the charm. "Like Test and T20 have their values, ODI cricket is also exciting. I really like it," he added. Several cricketers including Ravichandran Ashwin, Moeen Ali and Wasim Akram have questioned the relevance of ODIs.

54.title: BJP never betrays, destabilising state govts is to bring stability: Chidambaram
54.article_body: BJP never betrays the people of any state, destabilising state governments is to bring stability to governance in those states, Congress’ P Chidambaram said on Tuesday. His remark came amid the political situation in Bihar. "Encouraging defections from other parties is a welfare measure for upliftment of defectors. Breaking other political parties is to purify those parties," Chidambaram tweeted.

55.title: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi tests positive for COVID-19
55.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has tested positive for COVID-19. "Tested positive for COVID-19 (again!) today. Will be isolating at home and following all protocols," she tweeted on Wednesday morning. This is the second time that she has tested positive for COVID-19. Priyanka had earlier tested COVID-19 positive in June this year.

56.title: How can Ashwin be part of Asia Cup squad? I am surprised: Kiran More
56.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More said he is "surprised" to see spinner Ravichandran Ashwin being included in the squad for Asia Cup 2022. "How can Ashwin even come in this team? And every time. Even in the last World Cup he was picked in the team and...did not play. Look at his IPL record, it is not that good," added More.

57.title: Nitish let go of his 'niti' and 'niyat' due to his PM ambitions: BJP's Giriraj
57.article_body: BJP leader Giriraj Singh criticised JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar for breaking alliance with the BJP and said that Nitish has let go of 'niti' and 'niyat' for his PM ambitions. "BJP gave birth to Nitish Kumar. He (Nitish) cannot fight an election on his own", Singh added. Singh also called Nitish Kumar 'palturam' (turncoat).

58.title: If BJP allowed to become stronger, people may lose voting rights: Akhilesh
58.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that if BJP is allowed to become stronger, people may lose their voting rights. "Is there any election in the neighbouring country of China? If you go beyond, are there any elections in Russia?" he added. "Your employment is being taken away and the Constitution is also being attacked," Akhilesh further said.

59.title: Facebook parent Meta raises $10 billion in its first-ever bond offering
59.article_body: Facebook parent Meta Platforms has raised $10 billion in its first-ever bond offering as the company looks to fund share buybacks and investments to revamp its business. Apart from Meta, Apple and Intel had also issued bonds recently, raising $5.5 billion and $6 billion, respectively. In July, Meta had reported its first-ever quarterly drop in revenue.

60.title: Musk sells nearly $7 billion worth of Tesla shares, first time since April
60.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold 7.92 million Tesla shares worth $6.9 billion, as per regulatory filings. This reportedly leaves him with a 15% stake in the company. In April, Musk sold Tesla shares worth $8.5 billion while he lined up financing for the $44 billion Twitter deal and said he had no further plans to sell the company's shares.

61.title: Was my call; I have a body, so show it: Vijay on 'Liger' nude poster
61.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, speaking about the nude poster of 'Liger', said it was "completely" his call. He added that Karan Johar and the team were hesitant at first, however, they later agreed to do it. "I just get some ideas in my head...if I get excited by it, I do it...I have a body, so show it," he said.

62.title: Burglars drill hole in wall, steal liquor bottles worth ₹12 lakh in Pune
62.article_body: Pune Police said some suspected burglars drilled a hole in the wall of a warehouse on Saswad Road and stole 120 boxes containing liquor bottles along with digital recorder of CCTV cameras worth ₹12.65 lakh. FIR was registered at Hadapsar Police Station on Monday. Earlier, some burglars drilled a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri.

63.title: EV charging and biodiesel filling stations launched at Hyderabad airport
63.article_body: Electric vehicle charging points have been launched at the main car park and a biodiesel filling station at the public transportation centre (PTC) in Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. The charging stations, which have the capacity to charge a four-wheeler from empty to full in just one hour, can be used by all EV users, a press release said.

64.title: She's like my sister: Politician Shrikant Tyagi arrested for assaulting Noida woman
64.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police for allegedly abusing and assaulting a woman in Noida, on Tuesday said, "I express my regret on the incident. She is like my sister, the incident is political and was done to politically decimate me." Surajpur court sent Tyagi to 14-day judicial custody. His three associates were also arrested.

65.title: Egyptian singer with 2 wives & 4 children had proposed me: Urvashi Rautela
65.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela has revealed that an Egyptian singer, who had two wives and four children, had proposed to her. "I did not want to take such a decision, where I have to go and live so far, or he has to live here," she added. 'Sanam Re' actress, however, did not mention the name of the Egyptian singer.

66.title: Actress Ridhi Dogra responds after trolls blame her for Shamita, Raqesh Bapat's breakup
66.article_body: Actress Ridhi Dogra has responded after trolls blamed her for Shamita Shetty and Raqesh Bapat's breakup. "But this entire situation that I am being constantly being pulled into is not even being remotely my circus," she wrote. "If beating me down helps you channelize your hurt I'm happy to help. Carry on and god bless you all," she added.

67.title: Mumbai Police to launch initiative to reunite missing children with families
67.article_body: The Mumbai Police will launch 'Operation Reunited', an initiative to reunite missing or abducted children with their families. The 'Operation Reunited' will start from August 15 (Independence Day) and go on till September 15, an official said. The police have also appealed to people to inform them on helpline numbers 100 or 1098 about children found in suspicious conditions.

68.title: 16 of 26 sewage plants in Delhi do not meet quality parameters: Study
68.article_body: A Delhi Pollution Control Committee report has found that 16 of 26 sewage treatment plants in the national capital do not meet the Central Pollution Control Board's quality parameters. Nilothi, Najafgarh and New Kondli plants have been found to be the worst performers, breaching the standards set for each parameter by two to six times, the report added.

69.title: Expanding Delhi sewage system crucial to clean Yamuna: Jal Board
69.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has said that expanding the sewage system in the city is crucial to cleaning the Yamuna. The Delhi government had announced that it would clean the river by 2025 and the Jal Board has constructed 24 weirs and check-dams on the Najafgarh drain as part of the project. The Board held a review meeting on Monday.

70.title: F1 driver Ricciardo wants $21-million payout to leave McLaren: Reports
70.article_body: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo wants a $21-million payout to end his multi-year contract with the McLaren F1 team at the end of 2022, reports said. This comes as various reports claimed McLaren want to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri. Ricciardo, an eight-time F1 race winner, joined McLaren at the start of the 2021 season on a three-year contract.

71.title: Tiger Woods motivated me to play tennis again: Serena Williams
71.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams revealed that it was golfer Tiger Woods who motivated her to play tennis again after she was sidelined for a year due to injury. She said she spoke to her "friend" Woods, who told her to try getting back to the sport in "short spurts". Serena spoke of this while announcing her retirement.

72.title: Former Real Madrid midfielder Isco joins Sevilla on a free transfer
72.article_body: After nine years of playing for Real Madrid, Spanish midfielder Isco has joined their La Liga rivals, Sevilla. The 30-year-old free agent signed a two-year contract with the team that will start their league campaign at Osasuna on Friday. Current Sevilla manager Julen Lopetegui has earlier coached the attacking midfielder in Real Madrid and the Spanish national team.

73.title: Shake It Off lyrics were written by me: Swift on plagiarism lawsuit
73.article_body: Singer Taylor Swift responded to the plagiarism lawsuit against her song 'Shake It Off'. The singer said, "The lyrics to ‘Shake It Off’ were written entirely by me." Taylor was sued by 'Playas Gon' Play' songwriters for her song's chorus. In her declaration, she said she never heard 'Playas Gon' Play' song or of the group 3LW before the claim.

74.title: US' Antony Blinken meets South African Prez as part of Africa tour
74.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met South African President Cyril Ramaphosa at an airforce base in Centurion on Tuesday. Blinken, who is on a three-nation tour of Africa, later left for Congo. In his South Africa visit, Blinken launched the US' engagement policy with sub-Saharan African countries, calling the region a "major geopolitical force".

75.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinian militants in occupied West Bank
75.article_body: Israeli forces killed three Palestinian militants and injured dozens in a shootout during an arrest raid in the occupied West Bank on Tuesday. The Israeli military said troops were attacked by Palestinians throwing stones and explosives at them and that the soldiers retaliated with live fire. The shootout follows intense clashes over the weekend in the Gaza Strip.

76.title: Alleged terrorist planning attack on Independence Day arrested in UP
76.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested an alleged terrorist with ties to the Islamic State on Tuesday after interrogating him in Lucknow. Sabauddin Azmi was planning an attack on Independence Day, an official said. An illegal weapon and materials to make bombs were seized from him, he said. Azmi was booked under sections of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and Arms Act.

77.title: 1-year-old boy missing after falling into open drain in Punjab
77.article_body: A year-old boy fell into an open drain in Punjab's Kapurthala on Tuesday and rescue operations are on to save him, police said. The boy Abhilash and his four-year-old sister were crossing the drain by walking over a cement pole kept on it, when he slipped and fell. The boy's mother jumped into the drain but failed to find him.

78.title: Ukrainian guerrillas threaten Russian control in occupied regions
78.article_body: Russia's plan to hold referendums in regions under its control in southeast Ukraine has been threatened by guerrilla forces loyal to Kyiv, Associated Press reported on Tuesday. The resistance against Kremlin has killed pro-Moscow officials and destroyed trains and bridges being used by Russia for supplies. Further, the guerrilla forces have helped the Ukrainian military by locating key targets.

79.title: Assam Rifles officer injured as gunmen open fire in Arunachal
79.article_body: A Junior Commissioned Officer of Assam Rifles was injured after suspected militants opened fire at a patrolling team near the India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh on Tuesday. Troops were undertaking enhanced patrolling ahead of Independence Day when the shooting occurred from across the border, an official said. ULFA (I) and NSCN (K-YA) are suspected to have carried out the attack.

80.title: Rockets fired by Gaza militants killed 14 Palestinians: Israel
80.article_body: At least 14 Palestinians were killed by rockets fired by militants of Gaza as it clashed with Israeli forces over the weekend, the Israeli military has said. In the attacks, 47 Palestinians were killed, Israel said, claiming 200 rockets fired by the militants fell in Palestinian territory. Israel claimed victory over the clashes saying it killed two Islamic Jihad commanders.

81.title: Punjab logs 406 fresh COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths reported
81.article_body: Punjab reported 406 new cases of COVID-19 and seven deaths due to the infection on Tuesday, a medical bulletin said. Tuesday's fresh cases took the state's active case tally to 2,841, news agency PTI reported. According to the bulletin, two of the seven fatalities recorded in the state were from Mohali. Barnala, Jalandhar, Ludhiana and Rupnagar reported one death each.

82.title: National flags worth ₹16 cr sold in Assam ahead of Independence Day
82.article_body: National flags worth ₹16.07 crore have been sold in Assam so far ahead of Independence Day and 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Over 53 lakh Tiranga have been sold [in Assam]...20 lakh from Fair Price Shops and 33 lakh from [Assam State Rural Livelihood Mission]." Self-help groups have stitched 35,95,167 national flags in Assam.

83.title: 37 arrested in raid by anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong
83.article_body: Anti-narcotics team of police in Shillong conducted a raid in the city's Polo Bazar area on Tuesday and arrested 37 individuals, 27 of whom were drug users, an official informed. Banned substances including heroin weighing 8.97 gm, 20 nitrazepam tablets and 286.93 gm of cannabis were seized during the raids, the official added.

84.title: Films are meant to spread love, not meant to be cancelled: Kareena
84.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said the cancel and boycott culture "upsets" and "saddens" her. Talking about the efforts that went behind making 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Kareena said films are meant "to spread love and positivity". She added, "It's not meant to kind of be cancelled or spoken about in that sense and it upsets me."

85.title: Considered hypnotherapy to forget Lord of the Rings trilogy: Director
85.article_body: 'Lord of the Rings' (LOTR) director Peter Jackson called himself an "unlucky person" as he couldn’t enjoy the trilogy like an audience member. He said he "did seriously consider" hypnotherapy as he wished to forget the films and his years of work on them to be able to enjoy them. However, he admitted he didn't go through with the plan.

86.title: What is the issue: Chopra questions India picking 3 pacers for Asia Cup
86.article_body: After only three full-time pacers were named in the Indian squad for the upcoming Asia Cup tournament, former cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned the move by saying, "What is the issue?" "There is a lot of grass on the [Dubai] pitch...There is consistent help for the fast bowlers. We saw that in the IPL," Chopra said.

87.title: I've never set out to play these many games: Pollard on playing 600 T20s
87.article_body: Commenting on becoming the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history, West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard said, "It's an achievement in itself, 600 games in any format." He added, "I've never set out to play these many games." Pollard achieved this feat while playing for London Spirit at the ongoing The Hundred tournament at Lord's on Monday.

88.title: 3 suspected members of militant group NNC arrested in Assam
88.article_body: Three suspected militants of the Naga National Council (NNC) have been arrested from Assam's Cachar district over the last 24 hours, police said on Tuesday. Two of the three suspects were arrested from Shib Colony area of Silchar town on Monday, police added. On the basis of information provided by them, the third individual was arrested from Jirighat area.

89.title: Filled with gratitude on another CWG: Sharath on 4 medals in Birmingham
89.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal said he's filled with gratitude and happiness on his participation in another Commonwealth Games. He added that CWG 2022 was his best one. The 40-year-old won four medals, including three golds, in Birmingham. Sharath made his debut at CWG 2006 in Melbourne. Sharath and boxer Nikhat Zareen were the flag-bearers at the closing ceremony.

90.title: Now our govt is formed; everyone will get employment: RJD's Tej Pratap
90.article_body: After JD(U) broke its alliance with BJP on Tuesday, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav said that "now our government has been formed, everyone will get employment". "Now everything is up to the people, if the people want, they will get rid of BJP's fever in 2 minutes. We will accept whatever we get," Yadav said.

91.title: MS Dhoni said 'Fielding and running between wickets are non-negotiable for me': R Sridhar
91.article_body: Talking about MS Dhoni's captaincy style, former India fielding coach R Sridhar said, "MS...when he was captain, he led the fielding. And the running between the wickets was to me, an eye opener." He added, "MS said, 'Two things that are non-negotiable for me are fielding and running between the wickets'. And that is something which still holds true."

92.title: Female tourist dies after drowning in sea in Odisha's Puri
92.article_body: A female tourist died from drowning on Tuesday in Odisha's Puri after a strong wave swept away three friends taking a bath in the sea. The woman was declared dead when she was taken to a hospital after being pulled out of the sea. The incident took place around 11 am near the Digabareni area of Blue Flag beach.

93.title: Stones hurled during Muharram procession in UP after row over DJ
93.article_body: Members of two communities hurled stones at each other during Muharram procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Tuesday. Police said people from the Hindu community  complained about the use of a DJ in the procession and hurled stones at those participating in the procession. They complained that a "new tradition" was being set with the use of DJ, police added.

94.title: Thai PM Prayut to stay in power for another 2 years, says Dy PM
94.article_body: Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha will be in power for two more years, Deputy PM Prawit Wongsuwan said on Tuesday. This comes as the main opposition party seeks a court ruling to remove the PM this month, a year before an election is due. Prayut can serve a maximum of eight years as the PM as per the country's Constitution.

95.title: N Korea ready to send 100,000 troops to participate in Ukraine war: Russian expert
95.article_body: Around 100,000 North Korean volunteers are ready to go to Russia and take part in the Ukraine war, Russian military expert Igor Korotchenko said recently on state TV. North Korean builders are ready to work alongside Russian builders to repair war damage, Korotchenko added. He said the troops are "resilient, undemanding and motivated".

96.title: I had no strength, it was one of the toughest moments: Hamilton on Abu Dhabi controversy
96.article_body: Lewis Hamilton, who had finished second in F1 2021 season after Max Verstappen defeated him in the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix following a controversy, said, "I do remember just sitting there in disbelief." "I had no strength. And it was one of the toughest moments, I would say, that I've had in a long, long time," he added.

97.title: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' becomes 5th Marvel film to earn ₹100 cr in India
97.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Thor: Love and Thunder', starring Chris Hemsworth, Christian Bale and Natalie Portman, has become the fifth Marvel film to earn more than ₹100 crore at Indian box office. It is also the second Hollywood film after 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' to cross ₹100 crore this year in India. The film was released on July 7.

98.title: Was offered a role in 'Top Gun: Maverick' with Tom: Lewis Hamilton
98.article_body: Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton revealed that he was offered a role in the Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick'. "Cruise invited me to his set...when he was doing 'Edge of Tomorrow' and then we [gradually became friends]," Hamilton said. He added that declining the offer was "the most upsetting call that I think I've ever had [to take]".

99.title: Nitish's move driven by desire to run for PM in 2024: Chirag Paswan
99.article_body: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan on Tuesday said that Nitish Kumar's decision to sever ties with the BJP was driven by his "selfish desire" to run for PM in 2024. "I want to tell the parties which are now joining hands with Nitish Kumar that very soon, he will betray them as well and ruin their future," Paswan said.

100.title: Let's renew vow to defend freedom: Sonia on Quit India anniversary
100.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday urged citizens to defend India's freedom with "all our might" on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the Quit India Movement. "Let us not forget the price that millions...paid for India's freedom," she said. Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said the people should take a 'Unite India' pledge to develop the country.

101.title: China confirms outbreak of new Langya virus, 35 people found infected
101.article_body: A new type of animal-derived Henipavirus named Langya has been detected in China's Shandong and Henan provinces, the state media reported. So far the virus has infected 35 people causing symptoms like fever, fatigue, cough, anorexia, nausea, vomiting etc. As per reports, the virus may also cause kidney and liver failure and is likely transmitted from animals to humans.

102.title: Massive cliff collapses onto a beach in UK, pic goes viral
102.article_body: A series of cliffs collapsed along the Devon coast in UK on Monday amid heatwave. The cliffs collapsed at Sidmouth and East Beach. The collapse of the Sidmouth cliff was the result of a second major landslide along the Jurassic Coast in two weeks. Temperatures have caused cracks in the rocks causing them to collapse.

103.title: Alia shot a scene like a pro despite being ill, everyone clapped: Darlings maker
103.article_body: 'Darlings' director Jasmeet K Reen recalled how Alia Bhatt filmed a crucial scene in the film while she was sick. "Alia was ill one day, but she still came for...shoot...We rolled...camera and she gave her take like a pro," Jasmeet said, adding, "The entire set stood and clapped, not because she was unwell, but because they loved what she did."

104.title: Naxal arrested after encounter in Chhattisgarh, arms & ammunition seized
104.article_body: An injured suspected Naxalite was arrested and a huge cache of arms and ammunition was seized after an encounter with the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, a police official said on Tuesday. After the encounter, an SLR (self-loading rifle) with 29 live cartridges, an INSAS rifle with four live cartridges, explosives and Maoist literature were recovered, the official added.

105.title: Want to see Arshad and Neeraj in packed Pak stadium: Pak coach
105.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem's coach Syed Hussain Bukhari said he wants to see the athlete compete with Neeraj Chopra in a "packed stadium" in Lahore or Islamabad. "Neeraj is like our son. If Neeraj wins, we'll shower him with the same love as Milkha Singh Ji," he added. Arshad, during CWG 2022, broke the Games record to win gold.

106.title: AIADMK's first MP Maya Thevar passes away at the age of 87
106.article_body: AIADMK's first MP K Maya Thevar passed away on Tuesday due to cardiac arrest in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul at the age of 87. Thevar was handpicked by AIADMK founder MG Ramachandran to contest the party's maiden by-election in 1973. Condoling his death, former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam said, "It was he who selected the two leaves symbol for [AIADMK]."

107.title: 300 cooperatives onboarded as buyers on Centre's GeM portal
107.article_body: The onboarding of cooperatives as buyers on the Centre's Government e-Marketplace (GeM) was launched by Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday. Over 300 cooperatives have registered as buyers on the public procurement portal, Shah announced. Registering as buyers will give these cooperatives access to goods and services at competitive prices, an official statement said.

108.title: Assam & Meghalaya to hold border talks after Aug 15: CM Sangma
108.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Tuesday said that his government will hold talks with Assam's government to resolve the remaining six areas of dispute at the inter-state border after August 15. "We will be meeting in Guwahati," he added. Regional committees will be formed to take the process forward for the second phase of the border talks, he further said.

109.title: He had affairs with 8 women while dating me, always wanted sex: Giggs' ex to court
109.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs, who's on trial after being accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, had affairs with eight women while he was dating Greville, a court heard. Greville told the court Giggs had "full-on relationship" with the eight women. She stated that Giggs "always wanted sex", adding that she felt he was using her for sex.

110.title: It's my wedding date, don't want fans to imitate it: Naga on his tattoo
110.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya has shared the meaning behind his arm tattoo and said it's a Morse code for his wedding date. He also asked his fans to stop imitating his tattoo. "This isn't something you would want to imitate...I feel...bad when they tattoo these things," he said. Naga and Samantha got married in 2017 and announced their separation in 2021.

111.title: I'm very nervous about 'Laal...', haven't slept for over 48 hrs: Aamir
111.article_body: Ahead of the release of his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actor Aamir Khan in an interview said, "I'm very nervous right now, it's been over 48 hours I've not slept." "My brain is in overdrive, so I read books or play chess online," he added. Aamir further said he will sleep peacefully after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

112.title: Palestinians in West Bank to start flying from Israeli airport to Turkey
112.article_body: Palestinians from the occupied West Bank will be offered special flights from Ramon Airport near Israel's Eilat to Turkey, Israel's Airports Authority said on Tuesday. Palestinians in occupied territories can't fly from Israel's Ben Gurion Airport without special permission and often travel to Jordan to catch international flights. Notably, these flights won't be offered to Palestinians from Gaza.

113.title: Parliament panel seeks 1 adoption law for all including LGBT+ people
113.article_body: A Parliamentary panel report has called for a new law to make adoptions inclusive of all religions and the LGBTQIA+ community. The panel said such legislation should be more transparent, accountable and less bureaucratic. The recommendations further called for consonance between the Hindu Adoptions and Maintenance Act and the Juvenile Justice Act to make the process easier.

114.title: China, S Korea pledge to develop closer ties amid tensions in region
114.article_body: The Foreign Ministers of South Korea and China on Tuesday pledged to develop closer relations and maintain stable industrial supply chains. Notably, this comes amid tensions between the US and China over Taiwan. South Korea, a longtime US ally, is struggling to strike a balance between America and the increasingly assertive foreign policy of China, a report said.

115.title: K'taka govt planning construction of dams on Mahadayi river: Goa Cong
115.article_body: The Goa Congress claimed that Karnataka was planning to construct dams on Mahadayi river in violation of a Supreme Court order. A delegation led by Goa Congress chief Amit Patkar met Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai and sought his intervention. "We submitted a memorandum stating that people in Goa are...concerned about the failure of Goa government...to protect Mahadayi river," Patkar said.

116.title: Central Vista area for new PM's Office yet to receive clearance
116.article_body: The Central Vista's Executive Enclave, which will house the new Prime Minister's Office and Cabinet Secretariat, is yet to be cleared by the Delhi State Environment Impact Assessment Authority. A committee vetting the proposal had raised concerns over an "excessively high proportion" of tree removal from the site. The CPWD revised its proposal to comply with new rules.

117.title: Ramya Krishnan to shoot for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from Aug 10
117.article_body: Actress Ramya Krishnan revealed that she will start shooting for Rajinikanth's 'Jailer' from August 10 onwards. She said she is "very excited" about the film. As per the reports, the cast will be shooting for a special promo. The full-fledged shoot of the film will begin post August 15. Ramya had previously worked with Rajinikanth in 'Padikkathavan' and 'Padaiyappa'.

118.title: Sensitise officers handling human trafficking cases: Centre to HCs
118.article_body: The Home Ministry has ordered all High Courts (HCs) to organise a conference to sensitise judicial officers to deal with human trafficking-related matters. The government said it has noticed officers lacking awareness and training to handle such situations, leading to ineffective investigations. As per Central government data for 2020, there were 1,714 registered human trafficking cases in India.

119.title: AI Express crash survivors to build hospital for rescuers in Kerala
119.article_body: The survivors and families of those who died in Air India Express flight crash at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in 2020 have raised ₹50 lakh to build a hospital building for locals who had carried out rescue operations following the crash. The building will be constructed for a Public Health Centre, the only government health facility near the crash site.

120.title: Blasts at Russia's military base in Crimea leave 1 dead, 5 injured
120.article_body: One person was killed and at least five others were reported to be injured after blasts at Russia's military base in Crimea on Thursday, according to local authorities. The Russian Defence Ministry said that the "detonation of several aviation ammunition stores" had caused an explosion. There had not been any kind of attack, it added.

121.title: Nitish won't get that respect with RJD which he got with BJP: Sushil Modi
121.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Modi said Nitish Kumar won't get that respect with RJD which he got with BJP after he broke the alliance with them on Tuesday. "We made him CM despite having more seats...never tried to break his party," he said. "We broke only those who betrayed us. In Maharashtra, Shiv Sena betrayed us and faced consequences," he added.

122.title: Woman slips from rollercoaster seat, falls to her death in Germany
122.article_body: A 57-year-old woman died after falling 26 feet from a moving rollercoaster in Germany's Klotten on Saturday, authorities have said. The woman reportedly slid from her seat while the rollercoaster was taking a curve before falling from the track onto the ground. "There is currently no initial suspicion of criminal conduct", public prosecutors commenting on the woman's death said.

123.title: Biden signs $52.7 billion investment bill to compete against China
123.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday signed a bill to provide $52.7 billion in subsidies for US semiconductor production and research and to boost efforts to make US more competitive with China's science and technology efforts. "The future is going to be made in America," Biden said. Some Republicans joined Biden on the White House lawn to attend the signing.

124.title: Some play the game, others change it: Wimbledon after Serena announces retirement
124.article_body: After ex-world number one Serena Williams announced that she will be retiring from tennis following US Open 2022, Wimbledon tweeted, "Some play the game. Others change it. We hope the next few weeks bring you joy." The 40-year-old has won 73 singles titles, including 23 Grand Slams, on WTA Tour. Serena last won a Grand Slam at Australian Open 2017.

125.title: Shrikant Tyagi sent to 14-day judicial custody for assaulting Noida woman
125.article_body: Surajpur court has sent politician Shrikant Tyagi to 14-day judicial custody for assaulting and abusing a woman at a residential society in Noida. Tyagi was using an MLA sticker on his car which was allegedly given by Samajwadi Party MLC Swami Prasad Maurya. Tyagi was arrested from Meerut in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday.

126.title: Indian society highly sensitive to challenges of security: Jaishankar
126.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said Indian society is highly sensitive to challenges of security, perhaps to a greater extent than many of its contemporaries. India faces conventional and non-conventional threats of a wide range, he claimed. Having a large, pluralistic and diverse polity makes law and order issues and even internal security concerns more complicated, he added.

127.title: Crypto exchange Nuri GmbH files for insolvency in Germany
127.article_body: Crypto exchange Nuri GmbH has filed for insolvency with a Berlin court, the company said on Tuesday. It said the sell-off in the crypto market, the bankruptcy of the Celsius network and uncertainty in financial markets forced it to file for insolvency. "This challenging environment has had a lasting impact on the business development of Nuri GmbH," the company added.

128.title: Team India doesn't expect Kohli to score 70 or 100: Aakash ahead of Asia Cup
128.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli following his selection in India's 15-member squad for upcoming Asia Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said it doesn't matter if the batter scores a 40 or 70 because everybody has a role to play in the team. "The team doesn't expect Kohli to score 70 or a 100 or finish the game," he added.

129.title: Tea exports rise 7% compared to last year in 1st 5 months of 2022
129.article_body: Indian tea exports in the first five months of 2022 (January-May) increased by around 7% to 78.64 million kg, compared to 73.19 million kg in the same period last year, the Tea Board said. Most stocks were picked up by the UAE at 13.17 million kg, followed by Russia (11.52 million kg). The value of exports was ₹2,037.78 crore.

130.title: Sri Lanka hikes power tariffs by 75% amid economic crisis
130.article_body: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka on Tuesday said that it has approved a 75% hike in power tariffs. "The Commission decided to approve a fair electricity tariff, taking all these public and other stakeholder comments into consideration," Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said. Notably, small consumers will face a 264% hike in the power tariff rate.

131.title: Artist paints Tricolour in his eye ahead of Independence Day in TN, shares pic
131.article_body: An activist and miniature artist from Tamil Nadu shared pictures and videos of the Tricolour flag painted inside his eye, ahead of the upcoming Independence Day. UMT Raja from Coimbatore first painted the national flag on the very thin cloth-like film on a chicken egg's albumen (egg white). He then transferred it to the sclera of his eye, News18 reported.

132.title: Ryan Giggs kicked naked girlfriend out of room at 5-star hotel in Dubai, court told
132.article_body: Ex-Manchester United footballer Ryan Giggs, who has been accused of physically assaulting his ex-girlfriend Kate Greville, kicked her out of their room at a five-star hotel in Dubai while she was naked, a court heard. Greville claimed that Giggs flipped when she saw him message another woman. "He dragged me into the lounge...threw my suitcase...and shut the door," she said.

133.title: He used to scold me when I used to play a rash shot: Sehwag on Koertzen
133.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag paid tribute to former umpire Rudi Koertzen, who passed away aged 73 in a road accident. "Had a great relation with him. Whenever I used to play a rash shot, he used to scold me saying, 'Play sensibly...I want to watch your batting'," Sehwag tweeted. Sehwag further called Koertzen a "gentleman and a very wonderful person".

134.title: 8 women farm labourers among 9 killed as autorickshaw & bus collide in Bengal
134.article_body: At least nine people, including eight women farm labourers, were killed after an autorickshaw and a state transport bus collided head on in West Bengal's Birbhum district on Tuesday. All nine victims were travelling in the autorickshaw, Birbhum SP Nagendra Nath Tripathi said. The incident occurred at Mallarpur near Rampurhat. The women were returning from a paddy field.

135.title: 'Laal...' earns ₹11 cr from advance booking, 'Raksha...' earns ₹4 cr: Report
135.article_body: Aamir Khan starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has earned ₹11.5 crore from advance booking, whereas Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' has managed to collect around ₹4.5 crore so far, according to a report. While 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is releasing on approximately 4000 screens, 'Raksha Bandhan' has got around 4200 screens, the report stated. Both films are set to release on August 11.

136.title: EU enforces emergency plan to reduce gas consumption
136.article_body: The European Union (EU) enforced its emergency gas plan on Tuesday with member countries being asked to cut their gas consumption by 15% ahead of winter. The plan was framed to tackle a shortage in supply that could occur if Russia stopped deliveries as tensions mounted over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has already reduced gas deliveries to EU countries.

137.title: JDU-BJP alliance was nefarious, it was bound to break: Rajasthan CM
137.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said the JDU-BJP alliance in Bihar was "nefarious", which was bound to break. "The autocratic tendencies of [BJP has]...killed the democracy in Goa, Manipur, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh and now in Maharashtra," he added. Nitish Kumar resigned from the post of CM of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government in Bihar earlier today.

138.title: 4 Pakistani soldiers killed in suicide attack in North Waziristan
138.article_body: Four soldiers in Pakistan were killed in a suicide attack on a military convoy in the country's North Waziristan tribal district, the Inter-Services Public Relations Pakistan (ISPR) said on Tuesday. According to the ISPR, the suicide bomber rammed a three-wheeler into the convoy on Monday. The attack left seven others, including two civilians, injured, ISPR added.

139.title: 1st batch of Indian students stuck back home to return soon: China
139.article_body: China on Tuesday said it has started the process for the return of Indian students stuck back home due to the COVID-19 visa restrictions. "We believe we'll see the return of the first batch of Indian students very soon and we will continue to pursue it with relevant work while ensuring the safety against COVID," Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson said.

140.title: Bird collapses at PM Modi's residence due to dehydration, rescued
140.article_body: A two-member team of a wildlife body rescued a black kite from PM Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi, after the raptor collapsed because of dehydration, a statement said on Tuesday. The bird is currently under observation and will be released into the wild once declared fit, Wildlife SOS said.

141.title: Iran grants furlough to jailed Iranian-French academic Adelkhah
141.article_body: Iranian-French academic Fariba Adelkhah has been released by Iran on furlough for five days, her lawyer told Iranian media on Tuesday. Adelkhah, who is a resident of France, was awarded a five-year prison term in 2020 on national security charges after her arrest during a trip to Iran in 2019. France has called the charges on Adelkhah "politically motivated".

142.title: Bihar crisis is due to BJP's obsession with devouring regional parties: Alva
142.article_body: The Opposition candidate for the recently concluded Vice-Presidential elections, Margaret Alva, has blamed BJP for the ongoing Bihar political crisis. "It (crisis) is a result of the BJP's obsession with first destabilising then devouring regional parties, to grab their space for itself," Alva said. She added, "Maharashtra, AP, Odisha, Telangana, Bengal, Jharkhand...same game plan is in play."

143.title: Panchayat elections to be held in Goa tomorrow
143.article_body: Goa's Panchayat elections will be held on Wednesday (August 10) with 186 Panchayat bodies, across 1,464 wards, going to polls, an election official said on Tuesday. There are 5,038 candidates contesting in North Goa and South Goa combined, which have 3.85 lakh and 4.11 lakh voters respectively. The polling will start at 8 am and end at 5 pm.

144.title: Pushing Bihar into darkness, fear: BJP's RS Prasad on Nitish Kumar
144.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad on Tuesday stated that JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar insulted the verdict of the people of Bihar by breaking his alliance with BJP. "Why are you (Nitish) pushing Bihar into darkness, fear and uncertainty?" Prasad questioned, adding, "Today you're claiming that the same BJP, which made you the Chief Minister, is conspiring to break your party."

145.title: BJP leader thrashes ex-Armyman, vandalises his salon in MP; video surfaces
145.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) leader Rituraj Chaturvedi was booked on Tuesday after a video, purportedly showing him thrashing a retired Army personnel at the former's salon in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, surfaced online. As per reports, Chaturvedi had an old dispute with the salon owner. Chaturvedi, along with another person, was also allegedly seen vandalising the shop.

146.title: Happy to complete a hat-trick of CWG medals: Sindhu on winning singles gold
146.article_body: Following the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, Indian shuttler PV Sindhu tweeted, "Happy to complete a hat-trick of CWG medals and top it up with the big one (gold) for India." Sindhu won her maiden gold in women's singles event on Monday. Sindhu had won bronze at CWG 2014 and silver at CWG 2018 in women's singles.

147.title: France faces 4th heat wave amid historic drought
147.article_body: France's national weather agency said that the country is in the midst of its fourth heat wave of the year. The heat wave began in the south and is expected to spread across the country and last until the weekend, Météo-France added. The heat wave comes amid the most severe drought ever recorded in France.

148.title: Viral video shows fans dancing to 'Oo Antava' at India-WI T20I in US
148.article_body: A video shows fans dancing to the song 'Oo Antava' in the stands in Florida, US on the sidelines of the Indian cricket team's T20I match against West Indies recently. The song, picturised on Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Allu Arjun, was part of the film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. "The craze of Pushpa," a Twitter user commented.

149.title: Will promote Ramayana trail: Sri Lanka's tourism envoy Jayasuriya
149.article_body: Sri Lanka's newly-appointed tourism brand Ambassador and former cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya on Tuesday said that his country will concentrate on promoting the Ramayana trail to Indian tourists. Jayasuriya had met India's High Commissioner in Colombo, Gopal Baglay, on Monday. The Sri Lankan government aims to boost its tourism sector amid a severe economic crisis in the country.

150.title: Bihar crisis recalls days when Janata Dal was under one roof: Devegowda
150.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda commented on the ongoing political crisis in Bihar. "I have been watching the developments in Bihar. It made me think of the days when the Janata Dal Parivar was under one roof. It gave three PMs," Devegowda said. He added, "If the younger generation decides it can offer a good alternative to this great nation."

151.title: Justin Bieber speaks about racism at concert, says 'it's evil'
151.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber spoke about racism at his Norway concert, which took place on Sunday. While addressing his fans, the singer said, "We know that racism is evil. It's wrong." Justin said he and his fans "get to be the difference-makers". He added, "We get to be the ones to stand with our brothers and sisters and make a change."

152.title: I remember watching Serena, Venus with my grandmother: 27-yr-old Sakkari
152.article_body: Talking about 40-year-old Serena Williams and her sister, 42-year-old Venus, world number four Maria Sakkari said she remembers watching both ex-world number one players with her grandmother, adding it's great to still have them on Tour. The 27-year-old further said, "Serena is, in my opinion, the greatest female athlete." Serena and Venus have won 23 and seven Grand Slams respectively.

153.title: Nitish made a mistake in 2017 & has corrected it today: Ex-Bihar MP
153.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP from Bihar Ali Anwar on Tuesday said Nitish Kumar committed a big mistake by quitting the RJD alliance and joining NDA in 2017, and today, he has corrected it. "I welcome the decision of Nitish Kumar to join the grand alliance again and it's good for the larger interest of the people of Bihar," Anwar said.

154.title: Climate change worsened 58% of infectious diseases in humans: Study
154.article_body: Climate hazards like floods, heat waves and drought caused as a result of climate have worsened 58% of known infectious diseases in humans, including malaria, hantavirus, cholera and anthrax, a study stated. While flooding sickens people through disease-carrying mosquitos, rats and deer, warming oceans and heat waves taint seafood. Moreover, droughts bring bats carrying viral infections to people.

155.title: BJP MLA catches policemen extorting money in Rajasthan; 4 suspended
155.article_body: Four policemen were suspended in Rajasthan's Bikaner district for illegally extorting money from truck drivers on a highway, a police official said on Tuesday. This comes after BJP MLA Sumit Godara and other people caught the policemen extorting money and complained to top police officers. The suspended officers have been identified as Qasim Ali, Lal Singh, Sunil Kumar and Gopaldan.

156.title: Local AAP leader assaulted by CPI(M) workers in Kerala's Malappuram
156.article_body: A local Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader, Sawad Alipra, was allegedly attacked by CPI(M) workers at the office of a village panchayat in Kerala's Malappuram district. "I was beaten up on my face and dragged at the office without any provocation," Alipra said. Alipra was a local secretary of the CPI(M) before joining the AAP.

157.title: How much prize money has Serena Williams won in her career?
157.article_body: American tennis player Serena Williams, who'll retire after US Open 2022, has won 73 singles and 23 doubles titles in her career. The 40-year-old, who had turned professional in 1995, has won a total career prize money of $94,588,910, as per Women's Tennis Association (WTA). Serena is a 23-time singles' Grand Slam champion. She has won 365 Grand Slam matches.

158.title: Nepal bans entry of people coming from India over COVID-19 surge
158.article_body: Nepal has banned the entry of people coming from India amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. Recently, four Indian tourists, who entered Nepal from Jhulaghat border point in the country's Baitadi district, were sent back after testing COVID-19 positive. "We have also ramped up COVID-19 testing on Indians," Bipin Lekhak, Information officer at the Health Office in Baitadi, said.

159.title: Aamir, Naga Chaitanya visit National War Memorial in Delhi, pics surface
159.article_body: Ahead of the theatrical release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actors Aamir Khan, Mona Singh, Naga Chaitanya and the film's director Advait Chandan visited the National War Memorial in New Delhi. In the pictures that have surfaced online, they can be seen paying tribute to martyrs. The film, which also stars Kareena Kapoor Khan, is set to release on August 11.

160.title: Indian Youth Cong brings accident insurance scheme for its workers
160.article_body: On its 62nd Foundation Day, the Indian Youth Congress launched an accident insurance scheme, IYC Kawach, for its workers across the country. IYC President Srinivas BV said that the scheme has been introduced to "acknowledge the sacrifices of our dedicated workers". Notably, the scheme will be provided to all the workers in a phased manner.

161.title: 'Swarajya' will join politics at the right time: Ex-MP Sambhajiraje
161.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Sambhajiraje Chhatrapati on Tuesday said his newly launched outfit 'Swarajya' will join politics at an appropriate time. Unveiling the logo of his organisation in Maharashtra's Osmanabad, he said, "Swarajya will work for farmers, labourers, the cooperative sector, education and health." "We'll ensure that people who were deprived of power are strengthened," he added.

162.title: Hoist Sikh flags, not tricolour on August 15: SAD MP Simranjit Mann
162.article_body: SAD MP Simranjit Mann has urged people to put up Sikh flags on Independence Day, instead of the national flag as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "The best tribute to the 75th anniversary of Independence would be to liberate Ladakh from China, rather than fluttering flags. Besides, provide food and shelter to the poor," Mann had previously tweeted.

163.title: Netaji’s 'Delhi Chalo' site becomes Singapore's 75th national monument
163.article_body: Singapore has declared its iconic green site Padang its 75th national monument as the city-state marked its 57th National Day on August 9. Padang also happens to be the site where Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose gave the 'Delhi Chalo' slogan in July 1943. "Padang has special significance for...Indian community in Singapore," a professor at the National University of Singapore said.

164.title: Nitish to take oath as Bihar CM tomorrow, Tejashwi to be his Deputy: Reports
164.article_body: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar will take oath as the Chief Minister of Bihar as part of the Grand Alliance at 4 pm on Wednesday (August 10), reports said on Tuesday. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav will be his Deputy, reports added. The duo had earlier met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan to stake claim for government formation after Nitish exited NDA.

165.title: HC directs removal of encroachments on temple land in Chennai
165.article_body: Madras High Court has directed the local Tahsildar to inspect the properties belonging to Sri Venugopala Krishnaswamy temple in Chennai and submit the report to Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR & CE) Department. The department would proceed to remove the encroachments under the provisions of HR & CE Act in case any encroachment is reported, the court said.

166.title: Don't target Palestinian militants in Lebanon: Hezbollah to Israel
166.article_body: Militant group Hezbollah on Tuesday warned Israel against targeting Palestinian militants in Lebanon. This comes after Israel's defence minister on Saturday indicated the possibility of the country targeting Islamic Jihad members who could be spotted in "restaurants and hotels in Tehran, Syria and Lebanon". An Egypt-backed truce ended the recent fighting between Israel and Islamic Jihad on Sunday.

167.title: Air India CEO to meet employees to discuss eviction from staff housing: Report
167.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson is expected to meet employees residing in colonies that the airline owned in Mumbai and Delhi this week, Moneycontrol reported. He's expected to meet Air India's unions' representatives to expedite process of moving out of the colonies. Despite announcing reimbursement of expenses to vacate colonies, employees aren't ready to move, an Air India official said.

168.title: Difficult for me to do 5 films in a year, my two boys need me: Kareena
168.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan in an interview said, "I wish I could do like five films in a year." She added, "But...it's difficult for me...because my two boys (Taimur and Jeh) need me at this point." "I want to do...all five scripts right now, but...I can't. I'm going to be able to do...one this year, and...one next year," said Kareena.

169.title: You know you're getting old when candles cost more than cake, jokes Federer
169.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, who turned 41 on Monday, thanked everyone for all the "amazing" birthday wishes. "You know you're getting old when the candles cost more than the cake," Federer said jokingly. Federer has not played on the ATP Tour since undergoing knee surgery following his Wimbledon quarterfinal loss against Poland's Hubert Hurkacz last year.

170.title: BTS’ J-Hope shares RM, Suga’s reactions to his song ‘What If’
170.article_body: BTS’ rapper-choreographer J-Hope opened up about how RM and Suga reacted to his song 'What If' from the 'Jack In The Box' album. J-Hope shared, “RM had said, ‘I’m proud that you’re trying this kind of music’, and Suga said, 'I will listen to music when it comes out so I can enjoy just as a listener’.”

171.title: AppLovin offers to buy video game software maker Unity in $17.5 bn deal
171.article_body: Gaming software company AppLovin Corp on Tuesday made an offer to buy Unity Software in a $17.5 billion all-stock deal. The enterprise value of the deal is $20 billion and AppLovin will offer $58.85/share to Unity, an 18% premium on its closing price on Monday. As part of the deal, Unity will own 55% of the combined firm's outstanding shares.

172.title: 17 soldiers killed in suspected attack by IS affiliate in Mali
172.article_body: An attack by suspected members of an Islamic State affiliate left 17 Malian soldiers and four civilians dead near the town of Tessit on Sunday, Mali's Army said in a statement issued on Monday. Moreover, nine soldiers were reported missing, the statement added. Vehicles and equipment were also destroyed in the attack, as per the statement.

173.title: Maharashtra reports 1,782 fresh COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths
173.article_body: Maharashtra reported 1,782 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a health department release said. The state also recorded seven deaths due to the infection, the release added. Pune Municipal Corporation and Kolhapur district logged two deaths each, news agency PTI reported. Tuesday's new cases took Maharashtra's tally of active COVID-19 cases to 11,889.

174.title: Russia successfully launches Iranian satellite into space
174.article_body: A Russian rocket successfully launched an Iranian satellite into space from a base in Kazakhstan on Tuesday. Iran said their remote-sensing satellite, named Khayyam, has been fitted with a high-resolution camera and will be used for environmental monitoring. No other country will have access to information the satellite gathers, and it'll be only used for civilian purposes, Iran said.

175.title: Assam and Mizoram sign joint statement to resolve border disputes
175.article_body: The Assam and Mizoram governments on Tuesday signed a joint statement to resolve the decades-long border disputes amicably through dialogue. "Both the states agreed to promote and maintain peace and to prevent any untoward incident along the borders," the statement said. The Deputy Commissioners of the bordering districts of both states shall meet at least once in two months.

176.title: Nitish Kumar is opportunistic: Union Minister Ashwini Choubey
