176.article_body: Union Minister Ashwini Choubey has accused Nitish Kumar of being "opportunistic" after the alliance between the BJP and JD(U) broke down. "Despite having lesser seats, we made him (Kumar) CM. He has deceived the people twice," Choubey said. He added, "The BJP does not suppress...[or] betray anyone. Those people betraying Bihar want to create obstacles in its development."

177.title: Was told to pay ₹99cr in damages over swimsuit pics: St Xavier's University teacher
177.article_body: A St Xavier's University Kolkata teacher, who was allegedly forced to resign after a complaint from a student's parent over her swimsuit pictures, claimed she was also told to pay ₹99 crore in damages to the University. The University allegedly said the pictures posted on the teacher's Instagram "caused immense, irreparable damage" to its image and goodwill.

178.title: BJP only buys people, didn't want its agenda in Bihar: Tejashwi
178.article_body: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday said that BJP only knows how to intimidate and buy people, adding that they didn't want the party's agenda to be implemented in Bihar. "Across the Hindi heartland, BJP does not have any alliance partner, history tells that BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance," Tejashwi said.

179.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi got 'MLA' sticker on vehicle from Swami Prasad Maurya: Police
179.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted a Noida woman, got a 'vidhayak (MLA)' sticker on one of his vehicles from ex-MLA Swami Prasad Maurya. Tyagi, who was absconding after an FIR was registered against him, was arrested on Tuesday. "A high-level inquiry is going on regarding the gunners provided to Tyagi by Ghaziabad police," Noida Police Commissioner Alok Singh said.

180.title: RSS a body of upper castes, PM Modi a great dramatist: Siddaramaiah
180.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Tuesday called RSS an "association of upper castes" and dubbed the Central government's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign a "drama". He also called PM Narendra Modi a "great dramatist", adding that RSS and BJP have opposed the national flag, anthem and the Constitution. "How can they be patriots?" he asked.

181.title: Serena Williams announces her retirement from tennis
181.article_body: Twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion Serena Williams announced that she will retire from tennis following US Open 2022. "I've never liked the word retirement...Maybe the best word to describe what I'm up to is evolution...I'm evolving away from tennis...toward other things that are important to me," she wrote in a Vogue article. The 40-year-old had turned pro in 1995.

182.title: Previous govt in Bihar wasn't as per people's mandate: Sharad Yadav
182.article_body: After Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP and resigned as Bihar CM, RJD leader Sharad Yadav said, "The previous [BJP-JDU] government was not as per the mandate of the people." "It's only now that the state government will be as per the people's mandate...People voted for the very same alliance...that has been formed now," Yadav added.

183.title: Pic shows cluster of stars held together by gravity, Instagram users call it 'incredible'
183.article_body: NASA has shared an image of a globular cluster, a tightly bound group of stars held together by gravity, taken by Hubble Space Telescope. "Clusters like this one, located in...constellation Sagittarius, can contain millions of stars, many of them nearly as old as the universe," wrote NASA. While some Instagram users called the picture "incredible", another comment read, "I'm...taken aback."

184.title: JD(U) broke alliance because of BJP's intimidation politics: D Raja
184.article_body: The General Secretary of the Communist Party of India, D Raja, has commented on JD(U) breaking its alliance with the BJP in Bihar. "Nitish Kumar breaking alliance...is a strong indictment of the politics of intimidation practised by the BJP," Raja said. He added, "BJP's authoritarianism leaves no scope for cooperation. After Akalis & Shiv Sena, JD(U) is the latest example."

185.title: Rare colourful sea slug spotted in British waters for the first time
185.article_body: An extremely rare multi-coloured sea slug, Babakina anadoni, which usually lives off Spain and Atlantic, was spotted in British waters for the first time. The creature is 2 cm long and was found in Isles of Scilly. "It's one of the prettiest sea slugs I've seen...it's less than half the size of your little finger," a Marine Conservation Officer said.

186.title: Pak TV channel ARY News pulled off air for 'seditious' reportage
186.article_body: Pakistani TV channel ARY News has been pulled off air in several parts of the country, the channel confirmed on Tuesday. The channel, blocked by Pakistan's media authority, was taken down for allegedly telecasting "seditious content", an official from the channel said. Terming the decision "illegal", Ammad Yousaf, ARY network's Vice President, said the ban will be challenged in court.

187.title: BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance: Tejashwi Yadav
187.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, after staking claim to form a government along with Nitish Kumar in Bihar, said, "Across the Hindi heartland, BJP doesn't have any alliance partner, history tells that BJP destroys the parties with whom it forms an alliance." He added, "We did see that happening in Punjab and Maharashtra." Nitish ended the alliance with BJP on Tuesday.

188.title: No credit can be taken away: Manjrekar on India's ODI, T20I series wins vs WI
188.article_body: On being asked how much should be read into India's 3-0 ODI and 4-1 T20I series wins against a "bad" West Indian side, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "No credit can be taken away from India for these wins." He added, "Let's be nice to...West Indies. They are good people to hang with...West Indies in T20 cricket are no minnows or rollovers."

189.title: 1,000 challans issued for plastic ban violations in Gurugram since July
189.article_body: More than 1,000 challans over the use of single-use plastic (SUP) were issued by the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram between July 1 and August 6, an official statement said on Monday. Over 1,700 kilograms of SUP was seized from the violators, it added. The civic body has collected ₹7.35 lakh in fines during the same period, according to the statement.

190.title: Spiders could sleep like humans and have dreams: Study
190.article_body: A study has found that jumping spiders may sleep and dream like humans. Researchers observed that the babies of jumping spiders twitched their limbs while sleeping, the retinas in their eyes moved, and their legs curled. They concluded that these spiders might have a REM (rapid eye moment) sleep-like state, a phase of sleep closely associated with dreaming in humans.

191.title: Man saves dog on railway track from approaching train in Palghar
191.article_body: In a video that has surfaced on social media, a man is seen saving a dog sitting on a railway track from an approaching train in Palghar's Nalasopara. One of the onlookers at the platform helped the man climb up. The driver of the train reportedly seemed to have already spotted the dog and had slowed down the vehicle.

192.title: Kangana Ranaut diagnosed with dengue, continues to work on 'Emergency'
192.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has been diagnosed with dengue, her production house Manikarnika Films said on Tuesday. They shared a picture of Kangana working on the set of her directorial, 'Emergency', and wrote, "When [you've] alarmingly low white blood cell count and...yet you...work, it's not passion, it's madness." Reacting to the post, Kangana wrote, "Thank you team, body gets ill not...spirit."

193.title: After Delhi & Punjab, AAP recognised as State Party in Goa by EC
193.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday said that it has received State Party status in Goa from Election Commission (EC), following a review of AAP's performance in Goa Assembly elections. "After Delhi and Punjab, AAP is now a state recognised party in Goa...If we get recognised in one more state, we'll...be declared...a national party," AAP's National Convener Arvind Kejriwal tweeted.

194.title: Gurugram Police arrests gang of 4 involved in insurance fraud worth ₹6 cr
194.article_body: Gurugram Police has arrested a gang of four which allegedly cheated over 150 people of over ₹6 crore on pretext of reviving their lapsed insurance policies in last three months. The accused targeted victims aged between 50-70 years and had data of over five lakh victims. They had hired three female executives to call and get policyholders' details, police said.

195.title: Indian ship reaches B'desh port under transshipment pact trial
195.article_body: An Indian vessel from Kolkata port with cargo destined for India's northeastern region arrived at Bangladesh's Mongla seaport on Monday. The shipment arrived under the trial run for a bilateral agreement signed between India and Bangladesh in 2018. The agreement allows for the transshipment of Indian cargo through various routes to northeastern states via Bangladesh's Chittagong and Mongla ports.

196.title: Mahatma Gandhi's statue made from plastic waste unveiled in Noida
196.article_body: A 20-foot tall statue of Mahatma Gandhi made of around 1,000 kilograms of plastic waste was unveiled in Noida on the 80th anniversary of Quit India Movement. The statue symbolises Swachh Bharat Mission's 'Ek Kadam Swachhata ki Aur', a statement said. In July, a 'Plastic Exchange Mobile Van' service that exchanges plastic waste for eco-friendly products was launched in Noida.

197.title: Man cheats Delhi Sikh priest on pretext of kirtan opportunity in US
197.article_body: A 51-year-old man was arrested for allegedly cheating a Sikh priest of over ₹1 lakh on the pretext of providing a 'kirtan' opportunity in America, police said on Tuesday. The accused contacted the victim and promised 'kirtan' opportunities in America, a senior police officer said. The Sikh priest transferred ₹1.25 lakh to the bank account number given by the accused.

198.title: Nitish Kumar claims support of 164 MLAs after staking claim to Bihar govt
198.article_body: After staking claim to the Bihar government as part of 'Mahagathbandhan', JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar said he has the support of 164 MLAs in the 243-seater state legislative assembly. Kumar said he has submitted a list of the MLAs to Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan in Patna. "He (Chauhan) will let us know when oath-taking can take place," said Kumar.

199.title: Ex-Bihar CM JR Manjhi's party extends unconditional support to Nitish Kumar
199.article_body: Ex-Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi's Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM) on Tuesday extended unconditional support to Nitish Kumar and the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD)-led Mahagathbandhan. Manjhi's HAM has four MLAs in the 243-member Bihar Assembly while Kumar's Janata Dal (United) has 45 MLAs and RJD has 79. Kumar resigned as Bihar's CM on Tuesday and ended his government's alliance with BJP.

200.title: Mindy Kaling visits Priyanka Chopra's restaurant in NYC, shares pic
200.article_body: American actress-filmmaker Mindy Kaling took to her Instagram Stories to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York. "Dreamy dosas, kofta korma, chaat and so much more at @sona. Love you @priyankachopra," she wrote. Re-posting Mindy's story on her Instagram account, Chopra wrote, "Love you and your continuous support."

201.title: Even if I'm hanged I won't apologise: Man who shot at Owaisi's car
201.article_body: In an interview, alleged BJP member Sachin Pandit said he won't apologise for shooting at AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's car in Uttar Pradesh. "I don't care even if I'm hanged," he added. Referring to ex-Prime Ministers Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi's assassination, he said, "I want to give [Owaisi] a message...No one should've such arrogance that [they can't be harmed]."

202.title: Wrestler Divya Kakran shares proof that she played for Delhi after AAP MLA's tweet
202.article_body: Wrestler Divya Kakran, who bagged bronze at CWG 2022, took to Twitter to share a certificate to prove she had represented Delhi at a tournament. This comes after AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj tweeted that Kakran always represented Uttar Pradesh. Bharadwaj tweeted it in response of Kakran claiming that Delhi government has never helped her or given her any prize money.

203.title: BBMP launches helpline to tackle monkey menace in B'luru
203.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has launched a toll-free number for the citizens to complain about problems created by monkeys, birds and snakes in the city. Residents can register their complaints either on the Namma Bengaluru Sahaaya 2.0 mobile app or can dial 1533. Repeated attacks by groups of monkeys in several residential societies were reported in Bengaluru recently.

204.title: Indian diaspora in UK organise 'havan' for PM candidate Rishi Sunak
204.article_body: A group of UK nationals of Indian origin reportedly organised a 'havan' wishing for PM candidate Rishi Sunak's victory and well-being. The organisers of the 'havan' reportedly said that they endorse Sunak because they think he can save the UK from a possible financial crisis. The results of the UK prime ministerial race will be announced on September 5.

205.title: No party in NDA is safe with alliance partner like BJP: TMC leader
205.article_body: Amid the political crisis in Bihar, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said no political party in NDA is safe with an alliance partner like the BJP. "The BJP does not believe in smaller or regional parties' existence," Ray said. "Its policy ensures the wiping out of regional parties even if they are their allies," he added.

206.title: 770-page chargesheet submitted by police in B'luru acid attack case
206.article_body: Karnataka Police has submitted a 770-page chargesheet to a court in connection with the Bengaluru acid attack case that took place three months ago, police said on Tuesday. Police have named 92 witnesses in the chargesheet and arrested the culprit from Tamil Nadu. The victim, who is undergoing treatment, studied in the same school as the accused.

207.title: Women will get appropriate representation in state cabinet: Maha Dy CM
207.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said that women will get appropriate representation in the state cabinet. "The objection that there is no woman minister in the newly formed cabinet will be addressed soon," Fadnavis said. This comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday expanded his two-member ministry by inducting 18 ministers.

208.title: Ragpicker rapes & murders 46-year-old woman in Pune; arrested
208.article_body: A ragpicker has been arrested for the rape and murder of a 46-year-old woman in the Yerawada area of Pune. The accused attacked the woman after he found her alone at night, police officials said. He hit the woman on her head with a stone when she tried to resist the rape, the officials added.

209.title: Mullaperiyar dam safe in all aspects: MK Stalin to Pinarayi Vijayan
209.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Tuesday informed Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan that the Mullaperiyar dam is safe in all aspects. "Flood regulation of the dam is being done as per the Rule curve and gate operation schedule," Stalin said. Pinarayi Vijayan on August 5 wrote to Stalin seeking his intervention in regulating water discharge from Mullaperiyar dam.

210.title: UP man gets life imprisonment for killing mother over property
210.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura sentenced a man, identified as Hari Singh, to life imprisonment for killing his mother over property, officials said on Tuesday. The court also imposed a fine of ₹14,000 on the convict. Singh opened fire at his mother Chandravati Devi in January 2016, killing her on the spot, assistant district government advocate said.

211.title: Jitendra Agarwal appointed as DC of Delhi Excise Department
211.article_body: Jitendra Agarwal has been named the new Deputy Commissioner of the Excise Department by the Delhi government. He was holding additional charges of the Director of Archaeology, Special Secretary of ACL and Director (Panchayat). The government has also ordered an additional charge of the General Manager of Delhi Tourism and Transportation Development Corporation to IAS Geetika Sharma.

212.title: No morality, power is motive behind Nitish Kumar's move: RK Singh
212.article_body: BJP leader RK Singh on Tuesday raised questions over the political moves of Nitish Kumar, asking how he would justify an alliance with the RJD, which he has often called "corrupt". "All of this is politics for power. There is no morality and he should be ashamed," he said. Fifteen years of RJD rule took Bihar backwards, he said.

213.title: NIA arrests two terrorists in JMB case
213.article_body: Two Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) terrorists have been arrested by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). They have been identified as Hamidullah and Mohammad Sahadat. They were involved in propagating the JMB ideology and motivating youth to carry out jihad. “The accused are involved in propagating jihad by posting hateful and incriminating materials online in various groups,” said NIA.

214.title: PM Modi remembers freedom fighters, shares picture of Mahatma Gandhi
214.article_body: On Quit India movement's anniversary, PM Narendra Modi paid tributes to freedom fighters who strengthened country’s freedom struggle. He shared a picture of Mahatma Gandhi at the start of the movement in Bombay. “Inspired by Bapu, the Quit India movement witnessed remarkable participation from people across all sections of society including greats like JP and Dr Lohia,” tweeted PM Modi.

215.title: More rainfall likely in Pune, ghat regions till August 11
215.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast more rainfall in Pune till August 11 (Thursday) and issued a red alert for ghat regions around Pune including Bhor, Velhe, Mulshi, Maval, Khed, Ambegaon and Junnar tehsils. A three-day rain alert has also been issued for Mumbai. Raigad, Ratnagiri and Satara are still under a red alert.

216.title: Actor Saibal Bhattacharya attempts suicide, hospitalised in critical condition
216.article_body: Bengali actor Saibal Bhattacharya allegedly attempted suicide at his Kolkata home and shared a video of himself in a hurt state on Facebook, as per reports. He is currently admitted to Chittaranjan Hospital and is in critical condition, reports added. He was reportedly suffering from depression and also struggled with substance abuse.

217.title: Betrayal of Bihar's people: Bihar BJP chief as Nitish Kumar breaks alliance
217.article_body: After JD(U)'s Nitish Kumar broke alliance with the BJP earlier today, Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said, "Whatever happened today is...betrayal of Bihar's people and...BJP." "We fought the 2020 polls together under the NDA, the mandate was for JD(U) and BJP, we won more seats despite that Nitish Kumar was made the CM," he added.

218.title: Nitish Kumar elected leader of Bihar 'Mahagathbandhan' after quitting NDA
218.article_body: JD(U) chief Nitish Kumar has been elected as the leader of Bihar's Grand Alliance or 'Mahagathbandhan' which includes Left parties, RJD and Congress. He was elected as the leader of the alliance before reaching Raj Bhawan in Patna to stake claim to form government in the state. He exited NDA on Tuesday and resigned from the CM post.

219.title: What a legend: Hardik on Pollard becoming 1st cricketer to play 600 T20 games
219.article_body: After West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard became the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya tweeted, "Congratulations Polly, 600 matches and counting, what a legend." Pollard achieved this feat during his side London Spirit's match against Manchester Originals at ongoing The Hundred tournament at Lord's. He's scored 11,723 runs in the format.

220.title: Domino's Pizza quits Italy amid competition from local restaurants
220.article_body: Domino's Pizza has closed its last 29 branches in Italy amid tough competition from local restaurants expanding delivery services and has sought protection from creditors after running out of cash and falling behind on debt obligations. Domino's had entered Italy in 2015 through a franchise agreement with ePizza SpA. It had reduced operations in Italy from its peak in 2020.

221.title: Congress promises 300 units free electricity in poll-bound Himachal
221.article_body: The Congress has promised 300 units of free electricity to every household and ₹1,500 per month to women between the ages of 18 and 60 years if voted to power in Himachal Pradesh. The state polls are likely to be held in December. Congress' Bhupesh Baghel also said the old pension scheme will be restored if the party is elected.

222.title: Pakistani militant with $3 million US bounty killed in Afghanistan
222.article_body: Senior Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) leader Omar Khalid Khorasani with $3 million US bounty was killed in a blast in Afghanistan. "Khorasani and two other members of the banned outfit were killed in a roadside bomb attack...on Sunday evening," an Afghan Taliban spokesman said. Notably, this comes amid talks between Pakistan and the TTP that are being facilitated by the Taliban.

223.title: Don't issue European tourist visas to Russians: Estonia & Finland
223.article_body: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas and her Finnish counterpart Sanna Marin have urged European countries to stop issuing tourist visas to Russians, stating that they shouldn't be able to vacation in Europe amid the Ukraine war. Notably, both Estonia and Finland border Russia and are members of the European Union, which banned air travel from Russia after it invaded Ukraine.

224.title: Bus parked outside Pune school catches fire, no injuries reported
224.article_body: An unoccupied school bus parked on the campus of a primary school in Pune's Hadapsar area caught fire on Tuesday morning, but no casualties or injuries were reported, according to the Pune fire brigade. The officials suspect the fire to have started from the front side of the bus because of a short circuit in the electric wiring.

225.title: Will remain BJP ally, impossible to get leader like PM Modi: Bihar leader & Union minister
225.article_body: Amid the political crisis in Bihar, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party chief and Union minister Pashupati Kumar Paras said his party will remain with BJP as it's impossible to get another leader like PM Narendra Modi. "Our party is with the BJP 100%," he added. Nitish Kumar resigned as Bihar CM after ending his government's alliance with the BJP on Tuesday.

226.title: Told him 'I need biggest iconic star of India': Aamir on SRK's 'Laal...' cameo
226.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan will make a cameo appearance in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Aamir Khan has confirmed. Speaking about how he got Shah Rukh to do a cameo in the film, Aamir said, "[He's] a friend. I told him, 'I [need]...someone who can represent what Elvis Presley represented in America...I need the biggest iconic star of India.' He was...sweet and...said, 'Yes'."

227.title: Shami must go for the ICC T20 WC 2022: Kiran More
227.article_body: Former India cricketer Kiran More said that the Indian team won't go into the T20 World Cup 2022 until pacer Mohammed Shami "comes into the side". "Rahul Dravid...likes to have back-ups. If a bowler gets injured, someone like Avesh Khan can be useful...but...Jasprit Bumrah (if fit) and Shami will definitely go to World Cup," More said.

228.title: You have brought great laurels: Kohli to Indian contingent at CWG 2022
228.article_body: Following the conclusion of CWG 2022 in Birmingham, India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to congratulate all the Indian medallists and participants and wrote, "You have brought great laurels for our country...we are so proud of you." India finished fourth in the CWG 2022 medal standings. India won 22 gold, 16 silver and 23 bronze medals.

229.title: Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi Yadav meet Bihar Governor, stake claim to form new govt
229.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday to stake claim to form the new government in the state. Earlier today, Nitish Kumar ended the alliance with the BJP and resigned from the post of Bihar Chief Minister. Tejashwi Yadav has reportedly claimed the support of 160 MLAs.

230.title: Former cricket umpire Rudi Koertzen dies aged 73 in car crash in South Africa
230.article_body: Former cricket umpire Rudi Koertzen passed away in a car crash in South Africa. The 73-year-old was on his way back home in Despatch from Cape Town when a head-on collision near Riversdale took his life. Three other people were also killed in the accident. Koertzen officiated as an on-field umpire in 331 men's international matches.

231.title: I don't believe in perfection: Aamir Khan on 'Mr Perfect' tag
231.article_body: Aamir Khan, speaking about being called 'Mr Perfect', said he doesn't believe in perfection. "I think this tag was given...by...media because I'd a very long period in which...I didn't have a film that didn't work," he added. Aamir further said he really loves magic, adding that a magical moment is much more attractive to him than something that's just perfect.

232.title: BJP calling welfare schemes for the poor as freebies: TRS MLC
232.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha criticised BJP and accused it of calling welfare schemes for the poor as freebies. "Majority of Indian population is poor, every government, be it Centre or State, runs welfare schemes for them," she said. "The manner in which you're attempting to force...state governments to shut these down by creating an atmosphere is not correct," she added.

233.title: 2 suspected JMB members arrested by NIA in MP's Bhopal
233.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two alleged members of the banned Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) from Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. NIA recovered objectionable material from their possession, Mishra added. The accused were allegedly involved in propagating the JMB ideology and motivating the youth to carry out jihad against India, NIA said.

234.title: MP Arun Sao appointed Chhattisgarh BJP chief
234.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Tuesday appointed Arun Sao as new President of its Chhattisgarh unit. The 53-year-old MP from Bilaspur belongs to the Sahu community and was first elected to Lok Sabha in 2019. He will replace tribal leader Vishnu Deo Sai. The development comes ahead of Assembly polls in Chhattisgarh which are scheduled to take place next year.

235.title: Dividing people on caste, religion will weaken country: UP CM Yogi
235.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said India's strength lies in its unity. "When we're divided on the basis of caste, creed, religion, region and language, it only divides our strength, weakens India...and gives rise to disorder and anarchy," CM Yogi added. He was addressing a programme to mark the Kakori incident that took place on August 9, 1925.

236.title: Dalit yatra carrying 1,000-kg Ambedkar coin to Delhi stopped in Haryana
236.article_body: A group of Dalits who started a yatra from Ahmedabad to Delhi last week, carrying a 1000-kg brass coin featuring BR Ambedkar, was stopped from entering Haryana on Sunday. The group was reportedly prevented entry due to lack of permission from Delhi and Haryana police. The coin carried a message about the prevalence of untouchability despite 75 years of independence.

237.title: Pics show SDPI flag being hoisted at Bihar govt school; probe ordered
237.article_body: Pictures purportedly showing people hoisting Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) flag at a government school in Bihar's Nalanda have surfaced online. Some children are purportedly seen saluting the flag in the pictures. The district administration has ordered a probe into the incident. SDPI is the political wing of Islamic outfit Popular Front of India (PFI).

238.title: CAQM proposes ban on pre-BS-VI diesel vehicles' entry in Delhi from Oct 1
238.article_body: Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) has proposed a draft policy to ban entry of pre-BS-VI diesel vehicles in Delhi from October 1 if the air quality index exceeds 450. The policy will include ban on entry of diesel commercial vehicles. Fuel stations will also be mandated to sell fuel only to vehicles with valid PUC certificates from Jan 1.

239.title: In a first, Hyderabad Traffic Police issue advisory in Urdu on Muharram
239.article_body: In a first, the Hyderabad Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory regarding diversions imposed in view of the Muharram procession in the city in Urdu. "Henceforth we will be sending traffic advisories in Urdu language wherever we find it's needful to public," an official said. The traffic police also earned accolades from citizens on social media for this move.

240.title: 14-yr-old Dalit boy beaten to death on suspicion of theft in Varanasi
240.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by upper-caste Hindu men in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi. "My son...had gone to a shop...where the owner...along with his friends...accused [him] of stealing mangoes and rice. They...beat my son mercilessly until he fell unconscious," the boy's father said in his complaint. He was taken to a hospital, where he died during treatment.

241.title: July 2022 was Spain's hottest month in over 60 yrs: Weather agency
241.article_body: This year's July was the hottest month in Spain in over six decades, the country's meteorological agency AEMET has said. This July recorded an average temperature of 25.6°C, which was 2.7°C higher than the recorded average for previous months of July in Spain. The highest temperature was recorded in southern Morón de la Frontera town at 46°C on July 24.

242.title: Man poses as IAS Tina Dabi and seeks money, Amazon gift cards; arrested
242.article_body: A man from Dungarpur, Rajasthan was arrested for attempting to cheat people by seeking money and gift cards by impersonating Jaisalmer Collector Tina Dabi. The matter came to light when a RAS officer employed as Rajasthan government's UIT Secretary received an e-mail from the fraudster who sought an Amazon gift card from her. She called Dabi who alerted the SP.

243.title: We let ourselves down: India coach on 0-7 loss vs Aus in CWG final
243.article_body: Indian men's hockey team coach Graham Reid said the team didn't play well "at all" in their 0-7 loss against Australia in the gold medal match at CWG 2022. "There's a thing called energy...We didn't have that," added Reid. Reid stated the team failed to execute the aspects they had discussed. "We've a lot of work to do," he said.

244.title: All MPs, MLAs are at consensus that we should leave NDA: Nitish Kumar
244.article_body: After submitting his resignation to Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan, JD(U)'s Nitish Kumar said, "All MPs and MLAs are at consensus that we should leave the NDA." This comes after Kumar ended his government’s alliance with the BJP. According to reports, he will stake claim to form a new government in the state with the support of Lalu Prasad Yadav’s RJD.

245.title: 61 medals have been bagged, records have been set, I congratulate all: Anurag Thakur
245.article_body: Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur has congratulated the Indian contingent for their performance at the recently-concluded Commonwealth Games 2022. "61 medals have been bagged. Athletes have set new records. PM Modi would continue to boost their morale as they return to India," he stated. India finished on the fourth position with 22 golds at the CWG 2022 in Birmingham.

246.title: Soon political parties in different states will stand against BJP: Akhilesh Yadav
246.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday reacted to the ongoing political situation in Bihar. "I think soon political parties and people in different states will stand against BJP," Yadav added. "It's a good start. On this day the slogan of 'Angrezo Bharat Chhodo' was given and today the slogan of 'BJP Bhagaon' is coming from Bihar," he stated.

247.title: US healthtech firm Basys.ai plans India entry to build AI technology
247.article_body: Basys.ai, a Harvard-based healthtech startup, is in talks with healthcare providers in India and Singapore to launch its platform in these markets. The firm is depending on the central government's Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission, which aims to interlink digital health solutions across the country. The startup aims to collaborate with hospitals and build its artificial intelligence capability.

248.title: Union Minister Amit Shah urges cooperatives to register on GeM portal
248.article_body: Union Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday urged all the cooperatives to register themselves on the Government e-Marketplace (GeM) portal. Addressing the e-launch event for onboarding of cooperatives on the portal, Shah said more than 300 cooperatives, including 45 multi-state cooperative societies have been onboarded on GeM as buyers to buy goods from MSMEs and other businesses.

249.title: Nitish meets RJD's Rabri & Tejashwi after quitting NDA and stepping down as CM
249.article_body: After resigning as the Chief Minister of Bihar, Nitish Kumar met RJD's Rabri Devi and his son Tejashwi Yadav in Patna. Earlier in the day, Kumar met Governor Phagu Chauhan and tendered his resignation after ending his government's alliance with the BJP. As per reports, he will stake a claim to form a new government with the support of RJD.

250.title: CBI sends notice to TMC leader in cattle smuggling scam
250.article_body: After TMC leader Anubrata Mondal skipped meeting CBI officials on Monday in connection with the cattle smuggling scam, the probe agency has planned to send officers to his residence today to serve him yet another summon for August 10. “We have asked him to come to our Nizam Palace office on Wednesday morning at around 11 am," an official said.

251.title: AAP MLA removes toll barrier in Punjab, cars pass without paying fee
251.article_body: AAP MLA Karambir Singh Ghuman allegedly removed a toll plaza barrier in Punjab's Hoshiarpur to let his car pass on Saturday. A video showed other cars also crossing the barrier without paying toll after Ghuman removed the barrier. As per reports, Ghuman got angry and abused the toll plaza staff as they didn't remove the barrier immediately after his arrival.

252.title: Guj tribals believe in vision of Modi; won't fall for enticement: CM Patel
252.article_body: On the occasion of World Tribal Day, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that the development of Gujarat's tribal community has been happening "under Narendra Modi's leadership" for over two decades. "Gujarat [tribals] are more developed...than the tribals in...other parts of India...[They] do not fall for any enticements but believe firmly in the development vision of Modi," CM Patel said.

253.title: Officer shoots himself with service weapon inside Assam police station
253.article_body: An Assistant Sub Inspector posted at the Tinsukia Sadar police station in Assam allegedly committed suicide using his service weapon on Monday. He was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment. An inquiry committee will be set up to ascertain the motive behind the action. The deceased is survived by his wife and two children.

254.title: Inflows into mutual fund schemes dropped by 43% in July: AMFI data
254.article_body: The Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed that inflows into equity mutual fund schemes dropped by 43% to ₹8,898 crore in July as against ₹15,495 crore in June. This was the third straight month of decline in inflows as investors were booking profits amid a rally in benchmark indices. The net inflows in May were ₹18,529 crore.

255.title: We get over 300 applicants per job: US CEO who pays staff minimum ₹63 lakh/year
255.article_body: Dan Price, CEO of a US-based company Gravity Payments, tweeted that his company pays its staff a minimum annual salary of $80,000 (around ₹63 lakh) along with benefits like paid paternal leave and remote work. He remarked, "We get over 300 applicants per job." His company set a minimum annual salary of $70,000 for all employees in 2015.

256.title: Defence around Ukraine's nuclear plant to be beefed up: Russia-backed official
256.article_body: Anti-aircraft defences around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will be strengthened after days of reported shelling on the site, a news agency quoted a Russia-backed official. Yevgeny Balitsky reportedly said that Europe's largest nuclear station is working normally and damaged power lines have been restored. Russia and Ukraine blame each other for attacks on the nuclear power plant.

257.title: Indian airlines witnessed 478 technical snags in 12 months: Govt
257.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha on Monday that 478 incidents of technical snags were reported by Indian airlines in the one year between July 1, 2021 and June 30, 2022. With 184 snags, Air India was most affected by these issues followed by IndiGo and SpiceJet reporting 98 and 77 incidents, respectively.

258.title: 3 men cheat gangster Chhota Shakeel’s close aide of ₹50 lakh in Mumbai
258.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested three people on Monday for cheating gangster Chhota Shakeel's close aide Salim Fruit of ₹50 lakh by falsely promising to save him from the National Investigation Agency's (NIA) probe. Mohd Salim Mohd Iqbal Qureshi, aka Salim Fruit, was arrested on Thursday by NIA in a case related to the activities of the D Company.

259.title: EU submits its 'final text' for the revival of Iran nuclear deal
259.article_body: As indirect talks between Iran and the US to salvage the 2015 nuclear deal concluded on Monday, the EU said it submitted the "final text" for the pact's revival. Stating that there is no room for further negotiations, EU's foreign policy chief said that "behind every technical issue...lies a political decision that needs to be taken in the capitals".

260.title: Man takes bath in pothole to protest against poor roads in Kerala; video goes viral
260.article_body: A man took bath in a pothole to protest against poor roads in Kerala, with his video going viral on social media. The video comes days after a scooter rider lost his life due to a pothole in Ernakulam district. In the video, local MLA UA Latheef is also seen reaching the spot where the man staged his protest.

261.title: No representation of women in Maha Cabinet shows BJP's mentality: NCP MP
261.article_body: Following Maharashtra Cabinet expansion, NCP MP Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that women have not been represented in the state Cabinet. "Unfortunate that there are 18 ministers in state Cabinet...when 50% of the population in the country is of women...they are not represented in this Cabinet," Sule added. "It shows BJP's mindset," she stated.

262.title: Chirag says credibility of Nitish is zero, demands President's rule in Bihar
262.article_body: LJP chief Chirag Paswan reacted to Nitish Kumar's decision of breaking the alliance with BJP and said, "Today credibility of Nitish Kumar is zero." He demanded President's rule in Bihar and said that the state should go for a fresh mandate. "Do you (Nitish Kumar) have any ideology or not? In next polls, JDU will get zero seats," he said.

263.title: 'Mission Mangal' is seen as Akshay's film when it had 5 leading ladies: Vidya
263.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has called it unfortunate that 2019 film 'Mission Mangal' is seen as an Akshay Kumar film when it has five leading ladies. The actress added that the story couldn't have been told with just Akshay. "Someone was talking to me about my last hits...They didn't mention 'Mission Mangal' and they said, 'Woh toh Akshay Kumar'," Vidya said.

264.title: Man who attempted to 'assassinate' MLA Jeevan Reddy arrested in Hyd
264.article_body: A man who allegedly tried to assassinate TRS MLA A Jeevan Reddy last week has been arrested from Hyderabad. The man was identified as the husband of a village sarpanch who was recently suspended from the TRS. Police said the man had a grudge against Reddy as he suspected the MLA's role in his wife's suspension.

265.title: 2 held, juvenile apprehended for killing truck driver during robbery in Delhi
265.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men and apprehended a 16-year-old for allegedly killing a 27-year-old truck driver during a robbery bid in Delhi's Pul Prahladpur area. The truck driver was stabbed to death when he tried to resist, police said. The incident took place on Sunday when the truck driver had gone to ease himself, police added.

266.title: Mobile data services restored in Manipur amid law & order crisis
266.article_body: Mobile data services, which were suspended for five days from August 6 onwards, will be restored in Manipur with immediate effect, a state government order read. The services were suspended over a law and order crisis after a vehicle was set ablaze by three-four men in Phougakchao Ikhang, which sparked communal tensions. Section 144 has been imposed in two districts.

267.title: 'Lagaan' character shouldn't have been clean-shaven, there was no water: Aamir
267.article_body: Speaking about his 2001 film 'Lagaan', actor Aamir Khan stated that his character Bhuvan should not have been clean-shaven. "It's not been raining [in the film]...and this guy shaves every day. He has got some secret water supply," the actor added. Aamir further said director Ashutosh Gowariker wanted a particular look for the character and insisted on him being clean-shaven.

268.title: Very secure actor: Akshay on Raksha Bandhan co-star Bhumi Pednekar
268.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar tweeted an appreciation post for Bhumi Pednekar. He called Bhumi "a very secure actor" for starring in his upcoming film Raksha Bandhan. "My appreciation and respect for my friend and co-star @bhumipednekar has gone up so much. Takes a very secure actor to agree to do a film titled #RakshaBandhan that features 4 sisters," he tweeted.

269.title: Be nice please: Manjrekar on being asked if Indian team is SA of women's cricket
269.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar, on being asked if the Indian team can be termed as chokers or the South Africa of women's cricket, said, "You guys are so hard...Be nice please...the Indian women's team have done tremendously well." Manjrekar further said, "In this CWG and you have seen it in these last few months that India have taken a leap."

270.title: Passenger from Dubai arrested with gold worth ₹45 lakh at Delhi airport
270.article_body: An Indian resident was held at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport after being found in possession of 1,000 grams of gold worth over ₹45 lakh, officials said on Monday. Two gold chains were recovered from the man after a search of his person while approaching the exit gate. Officials have seized the gold and arrested the passenger.

271.title: Ready to lead India into the 5G revolution: Airtel
271.article_body: Airtel announced that it has acquired 19,867.8 MHz spectrum in 900 MHz, 1800 MHz, 2100 MHz, 3300 MHz and 26 GHz frequency bands in the latest spectrum auction. Having the widest mobile broadband footprint, it will lead India’s 5G revolution, said Airtel. It has also joined hands with multiple technology partners, including Ericsson, Samsung, and Nokia to deliver 5G services.

272.title: Lebanese buyer refuses delivery from first Ukrainian ship over delay
272.article_body: First ship to depart from Ukraine is looking for another port to unload grains as initial Lebanese buyer refused to accept delivery citing a more than five-month delay, according to Ukrainian embassy in Lebanon. The Razoni, carrying 26,527 tonnes of corn, had left from Odesa last week. According to ship tracking data, the Razoni has been anchored off Turkey's coast.

273.title: 600 games! What a milestone: Bumrah on Pollard playing 600 T20 matches
273.article_body: Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has congratulated West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard on becoming the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history. "600 games! What a milestone...amazing achievement for an amazing player! Congratulations Polly," tweeted Bumrah. Pollard, who made his T20 debut in 2006, played his 600th T20 game in The Hundred on Monday.

274.title: Sisodia's allegations against me on Delhi excise policy baseless: Baijal
274.article_body: Former Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Tuesday said allegations raised by Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on the Delhi excise policy "are baseless and are motivated against" him. "During my tenure as the LG, I upheld the constitutional values and laws of the land," Baijal added. Dismissing Delhi government's claims, Baijal said, "The record will speak for itself."

275.title: BJP is like washing machine; cleans leaders who go there: Sena leader
275.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Kishori Pednekar on Tuesday claimed the BJP is like a washing machine and once leaders go there, they come out clean. Pednekar's comment came following the induction of rebel Shiv Sena MLAs Sanjay Rathod and Abdul Sattar into the Maharashtra cabinet. Rathod resigned last year over his alleged link to a woman's death.

276.title: Taiwan carries out military exercises as Chinese drills continue
276.article_body: Taiwan launched military exercises on Tuesday as China continued its military drills that began last week in the aftermath of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. Taiwan's Eighth Army Corps spokesperson said that the military drills were scheduled exercises and were not in response to Chinese drills. Taiwan will carry out military drills again on Thursday.

277.title: India B bag bronze medal in open section of 44th Chess Olympiad
277.article_body: India B team comprising Gukesh D, Nihal Sarin, R Praggnanandhaa, Adhiban Baskaran and Raunak Sadhwani bagged bronze medal in the open section of 44th Chess Olympiad in Chennai. Uzbekistan bagged gold, while Armenia clinched silver in the open category. India 2 finished with 18 points. This is India's second medal in open category at Chess Olympiad, excluding online Chess Olympiads.

278.title: You'll not see successful actor say, 'I am a pan-India star': Hansika
278.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani, speaking about actors being termed 'pan-India star', has said, "You will never see a successful person introduce themselves as, 'Hi, I'm a pan-India star'." She added, "They will always say, 'I'm an actor, I am an Indian actor'." However, Hansika stated that there can be pan-India films. "I'm an entertainer. That's what I call myself," she said.

279.title: Whatever I learnt in B'wood is by myself, used my understanding: Kartik
279.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that he's an outsider in the film industry and knew nobody from Bollywood. "Whatever I have learnt in this industry, I have learnt by myself, using my understanding...that has really helped me," he added. Kartik has stated that he is a quick learner and that has helped him. Kartik recently featured in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

280.title: India should've kept an extra seamer: Saba Karim on squad for Asia Cup
280.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim has said India should have included an extra pacer in their 15-member squad for the upcoming Asia Cup. Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan are the only pacers in the squad. "Should have kept an extra seamer in the squad because teams usually play with three seamers," explained Karim.

281.title: It's a new beginning: Satwiksairaj on men's doubles CWG gold in badminton
281.article_body: Shuttler Satwiksairaj Rankireddy, who along with Chirag Shetty won India's first-ever men's doubles gold at the Commonwealth Games, has said it's like a "new beginning" for badminton in India. He added, "It's a great feeling we could do it...It [was] a fantastic day for the badminton players. With Sindhu winning gold, then we, so there is no looking back now."

282.title: BJP never initiated anything: Union Minister on Bihar political situation
282.article_body: Amid the political situation in Bihar, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Tuesday said BJP never initiated anything that may stir up a controversy. "BJP would want that government of JD(U), BJP and other parties, under the Chief Ministership of Nitish Kumar, continues to work strongly and this is in the interest of Bihar as well as the nation," he added.

283.title: 35-yr-old farmer, wife shot dead in UP's Hathras; probe launched
283.article_body: A 35-year-old farmer and his wife were shot dead in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district on Tuesday. The incident reportedly took place around 2:30 am when the couple was sleeping in their house. "Primary investigation...revealed that...bullet was fired from a distance of two-three feet. A country-made firearm and two empty cartridges were recovered from...crime scene," a police official said.

284.title: Live-action 'Pac-Man' movie in the works: Reports
284.article_body: A live-action movie based on the popular arcade game 'Pac-Man' is in the works, according to reports. Bandai Namco Entertainment, the company behind Pac-Man, and actor Justin Baldoni's Wayfarer Studios have teamed up to develop the project. It will be based on an original idea from 'Sonic the Hedgehog' creator Chuck Williams, as per The Hollywood Reporter.

285.title: Nothing went right: India captain Manpreet on 0-7 loss vs Aus in CWG final
285.article_body: Following the Indian men's hockey team's 0-7 defeat against Australia in their gold medal match at CWG 2022, captain Manpreet Singh said, "Nothing went right." "We...hoped for a close fight," added Manpreet. Australia beat India 8-0 in the final of CWG 2010, further winning 4-0 in the CWG 2014 final. They also beat India 7-1 in Tokyo Olympics 2020.

286.title: We strengthen our party, we don't weaken other: BJP's Shahnawaz to JD(U)
286.article_body: Reacting to reports that many JD(U) MLAs and MLCs told Bihar CM Nitish Kumar that their present alliance has been trying to weaken them since 2020, BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain said, "We strengthen our own party, we don't weaken any other party." He further informed that he is going to Patna and the party leadership will give an official statement.

287.title: UP man smothers 13-yr-old boy to death after failed sexual assault
287.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly smothering a 13-year-old boy to death after he failed to sexually assault the boy in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor, police said. The boy's naked body was found on August 4 in a forested area after he went missing the day before. Bijnor SP said that the accused had confessed to the crime during interrogation.

288.title: Man issues threat to bomb UP CM Yogi over police helpline
288.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police's emergency WhatsApp helpline reportedly received a message threatening to kill Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. The man, identified as Shahid, threatened to bomb the Chief Minister on the Dial-112 helpline, police said. An FIR has been filed at Lucknow's Sushant Golf City police station in the matter, and several teams have been formed to arrest the accused.

289.title: Mirchi Baba held for allegedly raping woman on pretext of helping her conceive in MP
289.article_body: Self-proclaimed godman Baba Vairagyanand Giri or Mirchi Baba has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman in MP who went to seek his blessings to have a child. The woman alleged that the incident took place in July and that she was fed intoxicating pills and raped. Mirchi Baba was arrested from a Gwalior hotel and brought to Bhopal.

290.title: Chicago-based coupon-finding firm Groupon fires over 500 employees
290.article_body: Groupon has fired more than 500 employees, which is 15% of its 3,416 headcount, the Chicago-based company confirmed to a media outlet. This has hit employees in merchant development, sales, recruiting, engineering, product and marketing teams. CEO Kedar Deshpande said that the layoffs and reinvestments in marketing will help the company generate positive cash flow by the end of 2022.

291.title: Chhattisgarh minor kills parents as sacrifice to cure ill brother
291.article_body: A 17-year-old boy in Chhattisgarh killed his parents by offering them in sacrifice at the behest of a tantric, to cure his mentally unstable elder brother, the police said on Tuesday. The tantric told the minor that his parents had done some black magic on his elder brother and he would recover if they killed their parents, an officer said.

292.title: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM
292.article_body: JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar met Bihar Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday and tendered his resignation as the state's Chief Minister. This comes after Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP. According to reports, he will stake claim to form a new government in the state with the support of Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD.

293.title: Our party will remain with NDA: RLJP President after Bihar CM ended ties with BJP
293.article_body: After Bihar Chief Minister ended his government's alliance with BJP on Tuesday, Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party President Pashupati Kumar Paras said his party will remain a part of NDA. "Earlier also an experiment was done between RJD & JDU but they can't stay together for long. Again such alliance is coming, it's not good sign for Bihar's development," he added.

294.title: Free education, healthcare isn't freebie, waiving off loans is: Kejriwal
294.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has filed an application in the Supreme Court, opposing a PIL against political parties promising 'freebies' during poll campaigns. "Providing free education and healthcare isn't a freebie, it's duty of any government," the party's national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said. "Waiving off ₹10 lakh crore...loans is a freebie," he added, taking a dig at the Centre.

295.title: Tree planted by Bal Thackeray falls amid rains, BMC replants it at same spot
295.article_body: A Gulmohar tree planted by Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at Shivaji Park ground fell due to heavy rains, an official said. However, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation officials replanted the tree at the same spot. "A wider and deeper ditch was dug, root hormones were applied to the tree along with fertilisers before replantation," the BMC statement said.

296.title: 2 electrocuted, 10 hurt during procession on eve of Muharram in Guj
296.article_body: Two people died due to electrocution and 10 others were injured after they came in contact with a live electric wire during a 'Tazia' procession on the eve of Muharram in Gujarat's Jamnagar, police said on Tuesday. 'Tazia' is a miniature replica of Prophet Muhammad's grandson Imam Hussain's tomb. The injured people were admitted to a hospital, Jamnagar SP said.

297.title: Viral clip shows students hitting each other with belts at birthday party in UP hospital
297.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows some pharmacy students creating a ruckus while celebrating a birthday in a civil hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Higher authorities have initiated an inquiry into the matter. The video shows the students hitting each other playfully with belts and running around the place.

298.title: Rana Daggubati deletes his Instagram posts days after announcing break from social media
298.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati has deleted all his posts from his Instagram account, days after he announced a "social media sabbatical". The reason behind Rana's decision to delete the posts isn't known yet. On Friday, the actor had shared a post on Twitter which read, "Work in progress!! Taking a social media sabbatical. See you at the movies, Bigger. Better. Stronger."

299.title: China closes Potala Palace after minor COVID-19 outbreak in Tibet
299.article_body: Chinese authorities on Tuesday closed Potala Palace in Tibet's Lhasa after a minor outbreak of COVID-19 was reported in the region. The reopening date for the palace would be announced later, according to an official notice. Notably, Tibet's economy is heavily dependent on tourism and the palace is a key draw.

300.title: 9 held in Faridabad for cheating 100 with fake job offers in pvt airline
300.article_body: Faridabad Police arrested nine members of a gang for allegedly cheating over 100 persons across India on the pretext of providing them with jobs in a private airline. Police recovered ₹3.22 lakh, 13 SIM cards, 12 mobile phones and laptops from the accused. "The perpetrators used to collect job seekers' data from job-related websites and placement agencies," police said.

301.title: I was body-shamed during teenage as I was overweight: Shark Tank India's Namita
301.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and Emcure Pharmaceuticals' Executive Director Namita Thapar in an interview with Chetan Bhagat revealed that she was body-shamed as a teenager as she was overweight. She said, "I wasn't like this when I was a kid...I had a lot of facial hair and acne…and I used to feel very ugly...No guy looked at me."

302.title: Man leaves hoax bomb threat letter at Faridabad Metro Station, held
302.article_body: Faridabad Police on Monday arrested a man for allegedly leaving a hoax bomb threat letter at Sarai Khwaja Metro station, police said. The accused suspected his wife was in an extramarital relationship and he wanted to frame her alleged lover for conspiring to carry out the 'blast', officers said, adding that the accused was inspired by television crime shows.

303.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from August 10-13
303.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts between August 10-13 from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm due to maintenance work being carried out by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL). Jakkasandra, Teachers Colony and parts of Venkatapura will face power cuts on August 10. Electronics City Phase 2, Veerasandra, Doddanagamangala and surrounding areas will face power cuts from August 11-13.

304.title: Sri Lanka acts after India's protest, asks China to defer military ship visit
304.article_body: After India's protest, Sri Lanka has asked China to defer the planned visit of a Chinese ship to the island country after initially approving its arrival. The Yuan Wang 5 was due to arrive on Thursday at the Chinese-built and leased Hambantota port. India had said that it would protect its security and economic interests.

305.title: Feeling 100% physically: Top seed Medvedev ahead of 2nd round in Montreal
305.article_body: Ahead of his second round match at National Bank Open in Montreal, top seed Daniil Medvedev said he's feeling 100% fit physically and is mentally ready. The world number one won his 14th ATP title in Mexico last week. He didn't lose a set at the tournament en route to claiming his first title of the season.

306.title: Pune University to create largest online album of people holding flag
306.article_body: To celebrate 75 years of India's independence, Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will attempt to set a world record by creating the largest online album of people holding the tricolour. "[For the] activity, we've created a...website. One has to upload a photograph [there]," an SPPU official said. SPPU plans to reach out to 5 lakh students for the initiative.

307.title: Blocking a spot for Karthik only as a finisher isn't right: Razdan
307.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Vivek Razdan said it is not right to block a spot for Dinesh Karthik in T20Is only as a finisher. "Who among Suryakumar Yadav, Virat Kohli, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya can't do that job of a finisher?" added Razdan. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth earlier stated that Karthik cannot be considered as a finisher.

308.title: We exposed BJP's 'agenda-less' monsoon session: Congress
308.article_body: A day after Parliament's monsoon session concluded ahead of its schedule, Congress party said that it exposed the BJP-led central government's "agenda-less" session, and criticised the party for "not raising important issues" in both the Houses. "Congress wanted to table rising unemployment issue...Agnipath scheme...BJP wanted to run away from discussing such matters," Congress' Gaurav Gogoi said.

309.title: MP govt to release 356 prisoners to mark 75 yrs of independence
309.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday said it will release 356 prisoners on August 15 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The prisoners, undergoing life imprisonment, will be released as per Union Home Ministry's guidelines and state government norms, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. Convicts serving jail term for serious crimes like rape won't be released, Mishra added.

310.title: 26-yr-old man stabbed to death in front of brother in Delhi, 5 held
310.article_body:
A 26-year-old man was stabbed to death in front of his brother allegedly by their neighbour and his associates, following a quarrel in Delhi's Moti Nagar area, police said on Tuesday. 
Four men have been arrested and a juvenile has been apprehended in connection with the incident, police said. The deceased was stabbed multiple times in his stomach and chest.

311.title: Nitish Kumar will remain Bihar CM if he joins Mahagathbandhan, says Congress
311.article_body: Amid speculations of a "split" between Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janata Party, Congress has said that Nitish Kumar will remain Bihar Chief Minister if he plans to join the 'Mahagathbandhan'. "If Nitish Kumar comes, we'll welcome him. If he comes, we will support him. A meeting of Mahagathbandhan is being held," Congress leader Ajit Sharma said.

312.title: Promise to fight for tribals' justice till my last breath: Rahul
312.article_body: On the occasion of the International Day of the World's Indigenous Peoples, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he promises to fight for justice for tribals till his last breath. "For making profits, 'Hum Do, Humare Do' are plotting to snatch away the due rights of the tribal community by bringing in new laws," Rahul tweeted.

313.title: 8-year-old girl raped by 55-year-old neighbour in UP's Maharajganj
313.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 55-year-old neighbour in Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh. The accused allegedly lured the minor on the pretext of giving her money before committing the crime, police said. The complaint was filed after the girl narrated the incident to her family. The accused has been booked under IPC's sections 376 (rape) and 506 (criminal intimidation).

314.title: 50-yr-old Mumbai man killed during party at aviation union office, 1 held
314.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Abdul Sheikh, was allegedly beaten to death during a liquor party at an aviation union office in Mumbai's Santacruz, a police official said, adding that the accused has been arrested. As per the complainant, the incident took place on Sunday night when Sheikh intervened in a fight involving the accused Nikhil Sharma, the police official added.

315.title: 23-yr-old Mumbai entrepreneur kills self after being unable to repay loan
315.article_body: A 23-year-old entrepreneur from Mumbai allegedly died by suicide on Saturday after he was unable to repay ₹14 lakh loan he took for his start-up. Investigation has revealed that he had taken loans to start a garment store in Dadar. "In the (suicide) note, he apologised to his mother for selling her jewellery to fund his start-up," police said.

316.title: Congratulations Nitish Kumar for the leadership of a new alliance: Upendra Kushwaha
316.article_body: Upendra Kushwaha, National Parliamentary Board President of JD(U), has tweeted, "Congratulations to Shri Nitish Kumar ji for the accountability of leadership of a new coalition in a new form. Nitish ji, go ahead. The country is waiting for you." Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter also tweeted, "Get ready for the Rajtilak, Lantern bearers are returning", triggering reports of the RJD-JD(U) alliance.

317.title: Russia launches Iranian satellite into space raising spying concerns
317.article_body: Russian rocket Soyuz carrying an Iranian remote sensing satellite Khayyam launched into space from Kazakhstan's Baikonur Cosmodrome on Tuesday. Tehran has rejected claims that Moscow might use the satellite to boost intelligence capabilities in Ukraine, saying it will have full control. Last week, Washington Post reported US officials were concerned over space cooperation between Russia and Iran.

318.title: This team is a great blend: PM Modi on Maharashtra Cabinet expansion
318.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday congratulated all those who took oath as ministers in the Maharashtra government. Eighteen MLAs were sworn in as ministers in the state today. "This team is a great blend of administrative experience and the passion to deliver good governance. My best wishes to them for serving the people of the state," PM Modi said.

319.title: Dowry demand by rich persons from wife's poor family rampant: Bombay HC
319.article_body: Bombay High Court stated that the "social menace" of dowry continues despite strict legislation, adding that demand of dowry even by rich persons against poor family members of the wife is rampant. The court was hearing a plea filed by a man whose daughter died in June 2001 due to 97% burns. A sessions court had acquitted the victim's husband.

320.title: All local trains between Pune-Lonavala to resume by August-end
320.article_body: All local trains between the Pune-Lonavala section which were suspended after the COVID-19 outbreak in 2020 will resume by the end of this month. As many as 14 more trains will be added to this route, taking the total trains running between the section to 27. Eight trains were back on track on Monday.

321.title: JD(U) MLAs told Nitish 'alliance trying to weaken them' since 2020: Reports
321.article_body: Many JD(U) MLAs and MLCs reportedly told Bihar CM Nitish Kumar that their present alliance has been trying to weaken them since 2020. Without naming Lok Janshakti Party leader Chirag Paswan, they claimed that he was one such example, reports added. They also reportedly told Nitish that if they're not alert now, it won't be good for the party.

322.title: PMC chief gets notice over renaming of garden in Salisbury Park
322.article_body: The Salisbury Park Residents Forum (SPRF) has sent a notice to Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar over the illegal renaming of a corporation garden in the locality. Ex-BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale has illegally put up a board renaming the garden after his father, residents have claimed. The SPRF has threatened legal action if the board isn't removed within 15 days.

323.title: COVID cases rising in Delhi, but symptoms are mild: Arvind Kejriwal
323.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that COVID cases are rising in the national capital but there is no need to panic. "Most cases are with mild symptoms. We will take any action necessary," he added. Recently, the central government wrote to Delhi and six other states and asked them to ensure adequate testing and promote COVID-appropriate behaviour.

324.title: Snap Inc launches tool for parents to monitor teens' contacts
324.article_body: Snapchat-parent Snap Inc rolled out its first parental control tool on Tuesday, which will allow parents to see who their children are talking to, barring the conversations' substance. The feature, called 'Family Centre', will allow parents to view who their children have messaged in past seven days. However, they'll only be able to do so with their child's consent.

325.title: Woman bank manager injured in acid attack in UP's Kaushambi
325.article_body: Two bike-borne men reportedly threw acid on 33-year-old Diksha Sonkar, a senior manager in the Bank of Baroda branch at Sayd Sarawan village in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district, on Monday. The incident took place when Sonkar was on her way to the bank on her scooter. Though her helmet protected her face, she sustained injuries on her legs and back.

326.title: Sundar Pichai, Mukesh Ambani attend The Hundred match at Lord's, Shastri shares pic
326.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani attended London Spirit's The Hundred match against Manchester Originals at Lord's. Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri shared a picture with them and wrote, "In the august company of two people who love their cricket." Shastri is currently commentating in The Hundred in England.

327.title: Ashton Kutcher was unable to see, hear due to rare disease; says 'lucky to be alive'
327.article_body: American actor Ashton Kutcher has revealed that, three years ago, he fought a "weird, super rare form of" an autoimmune disorder called Vasculitis. The disease "knocked out" his vision, hearing and equilibrium, Kutcher said, adding, "(I'm) lucky to be alive." The 44-year-old 'That '70s Show' star said it took him around a year to build his senses back up.

328.title: List shows India's sport-wise medal tally at CWG 2022
328.article_body: Out of India's 61 medals at CWG 2022 in Birmingham, 12 came from wrestling and 10 came from weightlifting. Further, India bagged seven medals in table tennis and para table tennis at the Games. India bagged the most gold medals (six) in wrestling. India won eight medals in athletics and seven in boxing.

329.title: Japanese designer Issey Miyake, known for Steve Jobs' turtlenecks, dies aged 84
329.article_body: Japanese fashion designer Issey Miyake has passed away at the age of 84 due to liver cancer. Mikaye was known for producing the signature black turtleneck of Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs. He was also famous for his pleated style of clothing that never wrinkles. Miyake was born in Hiroshima and was the survivor of the nuclear attack in 1945.

330.title: I'm told people are being paid to troll Aamir Khan: 'Laal...' director
330.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "I am told there are people being paid to troll Aamir Khan." He added, "This is deeply upsetting to hear and it's outright unfair. Why have I been trolling him for free?" This comes after the 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend against Aamir began on Twitter.

331.title: Kuldeep's performance vs WI has given management more problems: Manjrekar
331.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said Kuldeep Yadav's performance in the fifth T20I against West Indies has given more problems to the management in figuring out who would partner Yuzvendra Chahal in the spin-bowling department. "That's the problem when you try all recipes and all recipes are brilliant," he added. Kuldeep registered figures of 3/12 in the fifth T20I.

332.title: Kieron Pollard becomes first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history
332.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Kieron Pollard has become the first cricketer to play 600 matches in T20 cricket history. Pollard achieved the feat by taking the field for London Spirit against Manchester Originals in a The Hundred match on Monday. Pollard had made his T20 debut on July 25, 2006 for Trinidad and Tobago against Cayman Islands.

333.title: Who were India's youngest and oldest medallists at CWG 2022?
333.article_body: Indian lawn bowls player Sunil Bahadur was the oldest Indian medallist at CWG 2022 at 45. His teammate Dinesh Kumar, who turned 45 in June, was the second-oldest. Paddler Sharath Kamal, 40, was the oldest Indian individual medallist. Cricketer Shafali Verma, 18, was the youngest Indian medallist, while 19-year-old wrestler Deepak Nehra was the youngest Indian individual medallist.

334.title: Bihar Assembly Speaker tests COVID-19 positive, recovers in a day amid political crisis
334.article_body: A day after he tested positive for COVID-19, Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Monday said his test reports have come out negative. Sinha, a BJP MLA, will play a key role in determining the legitimacy of any new alliance in the state. Earlier today, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP.

335.title: Security guard kicks pregnant woman in Pakistan, act caught on CCTV
335.article_body: A security guard in Pakistan's Karachi was seen hitting a woman who was pregnant. He has now been arrested, local media reported. CCTV footage showed the security guard arguing with the woman, after which he slapped her. As the woman fell to the ground and tried to get up, the man kicked her in the face.

336.title: Russian airlines start stripping planes for spare parts amid sanctions: Report
336.article_body: Russian airlines, including state-controlled Aeroflot, are stripping planes to secure spare parts which they can no longer buy abroad due to Western sanctions, Reuters reported. At least one Russian-made Sukhoi Superjet 100 and an Airbus A350 are reportedly currently grounded and being disassembled. An engine from one Superjet has also been removed to allow another Superjet to continue flying.

337.title: Congress to launch 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on September 7
337.article_body: The Congress party on Tuesday announced that it will launch a Kanniyakumari to Kashmir 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on September 7. It will be a foot march covering 12 states and two Union Territories, senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. He added that the yatra will be about 3,500-km long and is expected to be completed in around 150 days.

338.title: Kenyans vote to elect new Prez amid rising cost of living, unemployment
338.article_body: Voting began in Kenya's presidential election on Tuesday, with Deputy President William Ruto and veteran opposition leader Raila Odinga as two major candidates. Kenya's 22.1 million voters will also choose senators, governors, lawmakers and woman representatives. Rising living costs, corruption, unemployment, state debt and drought are some of the election issues.

339.title: You're a mess: Arjun Kapoor on Sonam calling Brahmastra 'Shiva No. 1'
339.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor called Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Brahmastra' 'Shiva No.1' during an episode of 'Koffee With Karan', which she attended alongside actor Arjun Kapoor. "You are a mess, yaar Sonam," stated Arjun in response. Following a question over the number of friends Arjun has slept with, Sonam responded, "I am not discussing it, between my brothers there's no one left."

340.title: We are rivals, not enemies: Outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu in Rajya Sabha
340.article_body: Outgoing Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu in Rajya Sabha said members across the political divide are rivals, not enemies. "We're not enemies, we're rivals. We must work hard to outshine others in competition...not run down others," Naidu added. "I am thankful and moved by your love and affection," Naidu stated.

341.title: Man slits wife's throat in Mumbai after she refused to settle down in village
341.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man for allegedly slitting the throat of his wife after she refused to return to his village. According to police, the accused, Somor Konaay, a native of West Bengal's Murshidabad, came to Mumbai in search of his wife, Adinabibi Shaikh, who came to Mumbai in search of a job. The couple got married this year.

342.title: Bharti Airtel Q1 net profit surges 466%, revenue jumps 22%
342.article_body: Bharti Airtel on Monday posted a 466% surge in its consolidated net profit to ₹1,607 crore for the quarter ended June as against ₹284 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. The telecom service provider's consolidated revenue jumped by 22% year-on-year to ₹32,805 crore. Its stock closed 0.18% higher at ₹705 on the National Stock Exchange on Monday.

343.title: Chennai Petroleum cuts crude processing by 25% at Manali refinery
343.article_body: Chennai Petroleum Corporation said on Tuesday that it had cut crude processing at its 2,01,000 barrels per day Manali refinery in Chennai by 25%. This followed an order by the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board after residents from the area near the refinery complained of liquefied petroleum gas-like odour. The company said it is confident of resolving the issue soon.

344.title: 2 more grain-carrying ships sail from Ukrainian port: Turkey
344.article_body: Two more grain-carrying ships sailed from Ukraine's Chornomorsk port on Tuesday, Turkey's Defence Ministry said. The Ocean Lion, carrying 64,720 tonnes of corn, departed for South Korea and the Rahmi Yagci, carrying 5,300 tonnes of sunflower meal, departed for Istanbul. The shipment is part of deal signed between Russia and Ukraine after warnings of food shortages in parts of world.

345.title: Punjab farmers block highway over pending cane arrears worth ₹72 cr
345.article_body: Farmers on Monday began an indefinite protest by blocking a national highway in Punjab's Phagwara over delays in payment of arrears worth ₹72 crore to cane growers. While protesters only blocked one side of highway, they threatened to stop movement on the other side too if arrears weren't cleared. Protest is being held under banner of Bharti Kisan Union (Doaba).

346.title: Oil prices slightly fall amid 2015 Iran nuclear deal revival talks
346.article_body: Oil prices marginally declined on Tuesday amid talks to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal with the Brent futures falling 14 cents to $96.51 a barrel. The West Texas Intermediate crude futures declined 16 cents to $90.60 a barrel. On Monday, the European Union put forward a "final" text to revive the nuclear deal, awaiting approvals from Washington and Tehran.

347.title: Get ready for 'Rajtilak', tweets Lalu's daughter triggering reports of JD(U)-RJD alliance
347.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter Rohini Acharya on Tuesday tweeted, "Get ready for the Rajtilak (coronation), Lantern bearers are returning", triggering reports of an alliance between RJD and Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's party JD(U). Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with the BJP earlier today. He will meet the Governor at 4 pm, according to ANI.

348.title: Factory line upgrades disrupt Tesla's China-made car sales in July
348.article_body: Tesla sold 28,217 Chinese-made vehicles in July as against 78,906 vehicles in June as production was disrupted by a scheduled upgrade to its factory lines in Shanghai. The upgrade aims to raise the factory's weekly output to around 22,000 units compared to around 17,000 units in June. Tesla exported 19,756 Model 3s and Model Ys from China last month.

349.title: 7 dead in Seoul and surrounding areas amid record rainfall
349.article_body: At least five people died in South Korean capital Seoul and two in the neighbouring Gyeonggi Province amid torrential rain. According to the Korean Meteorological Administration, southern part of Seoul received 100mm of rain per hour on Monday, while some parts received 141.5mm of rain, worst in 80 years. The rain knocked out power and left roads and subways submerged.

350.title: JSW’s July crude steel production rises by 14% to 15.6 lakh tonne
350.article_body: JSW Steel reported a 14% year-on-year growth in crude steel production on a standalone basis at 15.69 lakh tonne for July.
