Its flat rolled products' production expanded by 15% to 10.72 lakh tonne from 9.34 lakh tonne in July 2021, while that for long items rose by 10% to 3.65 lakh tonne from 3.06 lakh tonne in the year-ago period.

351.title: Reliance Industries created 2.32 lakh jobs in FY22 led by retail arm
351.article_body: According to Reliance Industries' integrated annual report, the company added 2.23 lakh jobs in FY 2021-22, taking the total workforce to 3.43 lakh at the end of FY22. The retail arm added 1.68 lakh jobs while Jio employed 57,883 people. Jio, that added 130 million customers in FY22, completed 5G coverage strategy for top 1,000 cities with 100% indigenous technology.

352.title: Binance sent Apple Watches to all of us last year: WazirX ex-employee
352.article_body: A former WazirX employee told Moneycontrol that Binance sent Apple Watches to all employees of the Indian cryptocurrency exchange during their anniversary last year. "We always thought that Binance owned WazirX," said the employee, amid a spat between the two exchanges over WazirX's ownership. The employee also said that WazirX didn't allot ESOPs to its staff, unlike other Indian exchanges.

353.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial to be explored in 'Law & Order: SVU'
353.article_body: The defamation trial between actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard will be explored in an episode of the upcoming season of television series 'Law & Order: Special Victims Unit'. Pictures from the episode's shooting are being compared to the pictures of Heard taken outside the Virginia courthouse. Depp won the trial against Heard over her claim of surviving domestic abuse.

354.title: Talk about it, don't jump to conclusions: Rashmika on rumours of dating Vijay
354.article_body: Addressing rumours of dating actor Vijay Deverakonda, actress Rashmika Mandanna said that her fans can talk about it but they shouldn't jump to conclusions until she says it in her own words. The actress further said, "Sometimes I am like...I am doing five films a year but you are still coming and asking me, 'Who are you dating?'"

355.title: Cell therapy firm Eyestem raises $6.4 mn in Series A funding round
355.article_body: Bengaluru-based firm Eyestem secured $6.4 million in Series A funding round, taking its valuation to $46.4 million. The round was led by three pharmaceutical companies Biological E, Alkem Laboratories and Natco and saw the participation of existing investors Endiya Partners and Kotak Private Equity. "We'll remain focused on solidifying our cell therapy platform," Eyestem CEO said.

356.title: PNB scam-accused pays ₹7.5 lakh for recording Bombay HC proceedings
356.article_body: Vipul Ambani, the former CFO of PNB scam-accused Nirav Modi, paid ₹7.5 lakh cost towards the Bombay High Court library after being caught recording court proceedings. The court seized two mobile phones and airpods from him. Ambani tendered an apology saying he will not indulge in any such activities in any court proceedings in any court of law in India.

357.title: Cab driver steals woman's SIM, transfers ₹3.4 lakh in B'luru; arrested
357.article_body: The Bengaluru police on Monday arrested a cab driver for allegedly swapping SIM and siphoning money from a woman's bank account. The accused had reportedly used the SIM to activate victim's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) and other payment apps. He then transferred ₹3.45 lakh to his account and purchased a mobile phone and a scooter from the money, reports said.

358.title: WhatsApp to now allow users to leave groups silently, choose 'Online' status viewers
358.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced new privacy features for WhatsApp. Users will now be able to choose who they want to share their 'Online' status with. They will soon not be able to take screenshots of a 'View Once' message if the sender chooses to block it. Users will now be able to exit groups silently, without notifying others.

359.title: 2 passengers rob cab driver of phone, earpiece & cash in Pune; held
359.article_body: Two people were arrested after they allegedly hired a cab through a ridesharing platform and then robbed the 42-year-old driver of his phone, earpiece and cash on Monday in Pune's Hinjewadi. The passengers reportedly attacked the driver after asking him to stop the cab on the roadside. The duo was arrested within hours of the incident, police said.

360.title: Authorities forced me to quit as student saw my swimsuit pics: St Xavier's University teacher
360.article_body: A former assistant professor at St Xavier's University, Kolkata, has alleged that university authorities forced her to quit after a parent complained that he had noticed his son looking at photos of her in a swimsuit on Instagram, The Wire reported. The teacher said authorities told her it was "objectionable to put up...posts which might corrupt minds of young men".

361.title: Never expected to draw flak on 'Kesariya': Lyricist Amitabh Bhattacharya
361.article_body: Amitabh Bhattacharya, who is the lyricist of the song 'Kesariya', has said that the song being trolled was unexpected. "We never expected to draw flak on the words 'love storiyaan'...It's a modern film and not a mythological film," he added. Amitabh stated, "The characters belong to this generation...there can be a Hinglish word, that was our attempt."

362.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar ends alliance with BJP
362.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar ended his government's alliance with partner BJP on Tuesday. This comes days after Bihar leader RCP Singh quit the Janata Dal (United). Former Union Minister RCP Singh resigned from the JD(U) after his own party sent him a notice over corruption allegations.

363.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to meet Governor Phagu Chauhan today at 4 pm
363.article_body: Bihar CM and Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar will meet Governor Phagu Chauhan on Tuesday at 4 pm at Raj Bhavan. Earlier, reports claimed that Nitish has sought time to meet the Governor today. This comes amid reported tensions in the coalition between JD(U) and BJP. JD(U) and the Opposition RJD have called for separate meetings of their MLAs.

364.title: Karthik will probably be a reserve batter: Kris Srikkanth on Asia Cup
364.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said Dinesh Karthik will probably be a reserve batter for Team India in the upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "I doubt...he will be in the XI," he added. Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja stated he doesn't see Karthik being picked in the lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 if India play with an aggressive approach.

365.title: Pardes was offered to Madhuri, realised won't get innocence from a star: Ghai
365.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai revealed that Madhuri Dixit was offered 'Pardes' first, adding she liked the story. "Madhuri was already a big star by that time. People in my office...suggested we take her," he stated. Ghai added, "But [the character]...has the innocence of an adolescent girl. I realised I wouldn't get that innocence from a star...a newcomer would easily do it."

366.title: Noida authority sent notices to Tyagi before, but there was no action: Residents
366.article_body: The apartment owners' association (AOA) of Noida's Grand Omaxe society had made a complaint to Noida authority in 2019 about politician Shrikant Tyagi for trying to encroach upon the common area, society's AOA president Avinash Mathur said. Tyagi enjoyed a free run for at least three years, reported HT quoting sources. Illegal construction at Tyagi's residence was demolished on Monday.

367.title: Not comfortable with intimate scenes, had to be convinced: Madhurima
367.article_body: Actress Madhurima Tuli has stated that she is not comfortable doing intimate scenes onscreen, adding that she had to be convinced for the romantic scenes in music video 'Hayaa'. 'Hayaa' was directed by her brother Shrikant Tuli. "The scenes in 'Hayaa' were not really vulgar...They were...sensuous in a good way. There was also no kissing or love-making," the actress added.

368.title: Govt declares assets of PM Modi, movable assets increase to ₹2.23 crore
368.article_body: The Prime Minister's Office has declared PM Narendra Modi's assets, which showed that his movable assets increased by ₹26.13 lakh during 2021-22 to ₹2,23,82,504. This includes a fixed deposit, bank balance, life insurance policies and jewellery among other things. It also stated that he no longer owns any immovable property after donating his share in a residential plot in Gujarat.

369.title: Salman Khan is lot like me, he has grown up looking at me: Jackie Shroff
369.article_body: Actor Jackie Shroff has said that actor Salman Khan is a lot like him. "The way he dresses, walks and speaks. You know, he has grown up looking at me, I think," he added. "I don't have anyone like Salman Khan in my life...but with Salman, I feel he is mine. I see myself in him," Jackie further stated.

370.title: We're not making this debate, media is: Alia on north-south cinema
370.article_body: Speaking about the north-south cinema debate, actress Alia Bhatt stated that members of the film industry are not making the debate but the media is. "We're very happy and we want to work with each other. Please let us and don't debate," she added. Alia further said that there is some unnecessary attention and scrutiny on the Hindi film industry.

371.title: If I were the selector, Shami would've been in squad for Asia Cup: Srikkanth
371.article_body: Ex-chief selector Kris Srikkanth has said if he were the current chairman of the selection committee, then Mohammad Shami would've been included in India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup. "We are going with one medium pacer short. Two wrist spinners are fine. I feel bad for Axar Patel, who has missed out. I'm happy for Deepak Hooda," he added.

372.title: Zero on ground, want to become hero by giving 'revadis': BJP on Kejriwal’s remark
372.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia reacted to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's "freebies" remark. "Responding to his (Kejriwal) press conference, the people of…India are saying that those who are zeroes at the ground level, want to become heroes by distributing 'revadis'," Bhatia added. "There are some people who call the provision of free education...as 'revadi' or 'freebies'," Kejriwal had said.

373.title: Pune-based businessman seeking petrol pump licence cheated of ₹42 lakh
373.article_body: A Pune-based businessman, seeking a petrol pump licence, was cheated of ₹42 lakh, police said. The victim in July had filed a form on a website that offered a fuel dispensing licence from a petroleum company. The complainant gave ₹42 lakh to the accused via multiple online transactions after he was informed that his application had been approved, police added.

374.title: Can't predict what will happen today: Bihar minister Shahnawaz Hussain
374.article_body: Bihar BJP minister Syed Shahnawaz Hussain said that he cannot predict what will happen in Bihar on Tuesday. "I'm a state minister...attending the investors' summit was important for me. If I hadn't attended it, how would Bihar have been perceived?" Hussain added. CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and the Opposition RJD have called for separate meetings of their MLAs in Patna.

375.title: Arvind Kejriwal to visit North Gujarat tomorrow
375.article_body: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal will be visiting North Gujarat on August 10 ahead of Assembly polls that are slated to be held later this year. “Kejriwal will hold Town Hall in Palanpur that will be attended by people from all walks of life,” said AAP spokesperson. This will be his 10th visit to the state in last four months.

376.title: PM Modi remembers Prophet Muhammad’s grandson on Muharram
376.article_body: On the occasion of Muharram, Prime Minister Modi remembered the sacrifices of Prophet Muhammad's grandson Hazrat Imam Hussain. “Today is a day to recall the sacrifices of Hazrat Imam Hussain (AS). He is remembered for his unwavering commitment to truth and his fight against injustice. He also placed great importance on equality and brotherhood,” said PM Modi.

377.title: 7-yr-old boy drowns in canal in Gurugram; NDRF holds search ops
377.article_body: A seven-year-old boy allegedly drowned in an overflowing canal at a village in Gurugram. A station house officer said that a team of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has taken over the search operations on Tuesday, adding, "Monday's search operation continued till 8 pm but neither the boy, [nor] his body could be found." The incident occurred on Sunday.

378.title: India's Sharath Kamal wins more gold medals than 56 countries at CWG 2022
378.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal bagged more gold medals than 56 nations/territories at CWG 2022. He won a total of three gold medals at the Games. Out of the 72 countries/territories that took part in CWG 2022, only 16 bagged three or more gold medals. Sharath has bagged seven gold medals in CWG history.

379.title: Volcanic eruption in Tonga blew 58,000 swimming pools of water into the atmosphere
379.article_body: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai submarine volcano eruption shot 38 billion gallons of water into the atmosphere, enough to fill 58,000 Olympic swimming pools, according to a new study published in the journal Geophysical Research Letters. The study was led by NASA scientist Luis Millán. The January 15 eruption was one of the largest recorded in the past 140 years.

380.title: What an incredible CWG it has been for us, congratulations to all: Sania Mirza
380.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has congratulated the country's Commonwealth Games contingent for their performance in the 2022 Birmingham Games. "What an incredible CWG it has been for us...congratulations to the entire contingent...entire country is so proud of you," tweeted Mirza. India finished on the fourth position with 61 medals, including 22 golds, at CWG 2022.

381.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging in parts of Hyd, traffic affected
381.article_body: Heavy rainfall lashed Hyderabad on Tuesday morning, causing waterlogging and traffic jams across several parts of the city. The area of Bahadurpura received the maximum rainfall at 9.1 mm, followed by 8.3 mm of rainfall in Charminar and 8 mm of rainfall in Golconda. According to India Meteorological Department (IMD), Hyderabad is expected to witness rainfall till August 12.

382.title: 4 AMU students suspended for violence, attack on other students
382.article_body: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) on Monday suspended four students following charges of violence and attack on other students. The university had received two complaints, AMU Proctor said. One complainant claimed that three students had physically assaulted and attempted to kidnap him, while the other complainant alleged that a student had attempted to kill him by opening fire, the Proctor added.

383.title: 29 people arrested in cases related to Ponzi schemes since 2019: Govt
383.article_body: About 29 people have been arrested in cases related to Ponzi schemes since 2019, Centre informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. Out of these, the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested 21 people from 2019 to June 2022, said Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad. Further, eight were arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in last three years, Karad added.

384.title: All 16 BJP ministers in Bihar to resign today, seek meeting with Governor: Report
384.article_body: After Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, the BJP has sought time for a meeting with Governor Phagu Chauhan today, reports said. All 16 BJP ministers in the state cabinet will tender their resignations to the Governor on Tuesday, reports added. Earlier today, Bihar BJP leaders met at Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad's residence.

385.title: We make same mistakes again and again: Harmanpreet on CWG final loss vs Aus
385.article_body: Following India Women's nine-run loss against Australia in the gold medal match at CWG 2022, captain Harmanpreet Kaur said, "Every time in big finals, we make the same mistakes again and again (with the bat)." "That's something we've to improve," added Harmanpreet. "We could've easily won gold," she stated. India lost eight wickets for 34 runs while chasing 162.

386.title: Table hit Aamir's chest, he had hairline fracture in ribs: Actor on 'Laal...'
386.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' actor Harry Parmar said that a table hit actor Aamir Khan's chest during a fight sequence in the movie. "Aamir was to charge upon me and we had to fall down on a bar table. The camera angle was such that we could not have any padding...He even had a hairline fracture in the ribs," he added.

387.title: Kerala HC gives a week to NHAI to fix all potholes
387.article_body: Kerala HC has directed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to take immediate steps to rectify every road under their purview within a week. It also asked the authorities to take necessary action against contractors, engineers responsible for pothole-ridden roads. The court also noted that the District Collectors cannot be mere spectators and react solely when an accident happens.

388.title: 5 of family killed as car rams into truck from rear in Andhra Pradesh
388.article_body: At least five members of a family were killed when a car they were travelling in rammed into a truck from the rear on Amaravati-Anantapur highway in Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam on Monday, police said. "The car was being driven at a high speed...driver failed to notice the truck going on at a slow pace at a road curve," police added.

389.title: If he is ready for the reaction then why not: Sonu on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
389.article_body: Speaking about actor Ranveer Singh's nude pictures for Paper Magazine, actor Sonu Sood said that it's an individual's choice to do a photoshoot the way they want. He further said that we live in a world where people point fingers at you so you need to get ready for such reactions. "So...if someone is ready then why not?" Sonu added.

390.title: Father, son who killed black man in US get life sentence for hate crime
390.article_body: The father and son, who killed unarmed black man Ahmaud Arbery in February 2020 in a Georgia neighbourhood, have each received a second life sentence on Monday for committing federal hate crimes. Travis McMichael and his father Greg McMichael were earlier sentenced to life without parole in a state court. Arbery was killed while he was jogging.

391.title: 3 more arrested for assaulting policeman inside police station in Delhi
391.article_body: Days after a video went viral showing a group of men assaulting a Delhi Police head constable inside Anand Vihar police station, the Delhi Police arrested three more persons in connection with the case. Police had earlier arrested advocate Satish Kumar, brother of prime accused Ajay, and extended his police custody for a day for identification of other suspects.

392.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar seeks time to meet Governor amid tensions with BJP: Report
392.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has sought time to meet Governor Phagu Chauhan today, reports claimed. This comes after Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and the Opposition RJD called separate meetings of their MLAs in Patna. RJD leaders began arriving at party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's residence on Tuesday morning and were asked to hand over their mobile phones ahead of the meeting.

393.title: Defence Expo to be held in Gandhinagar from Oct 18
393.article_body: The Ministry of Defence has announced to hold Defence Expo in Gandhinagar from October 18 to 22. The theme for this edition is ‘Path to Pride’, invoking nationalistic pride and encouraging citizens to take part in nation-building. The exhibition is in line with the vision of PM Modi to achieve self-reliance and achieve export of $5 billion by 2025.

394.title: Both Pant and Karthik will play in my XI: Kiran More on India's XI for Asia Cup
394.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More has said both wicketkeepers Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik should be included in Team India's playing XI in the Asia Cup. "I will probably sit out Deepak Hooda from the team and play with Hardik Pandya, Pant, Karthik and Jadeja," stated More. India's squad for the upcoming Asia Cup was announced on Monday.

395.title: Delhi Police busts gang making spurious engine oil, 7 arrested
395.article_body: Delhi Police has busted a gang that was manufacturing and selling spurious lubricating engine oil and arrested seven people, including the factory's owner. The factory owner worked in an oil company previously and learnt about the trade while employed there. Police recovered counterfeit engine oil and five 200-litre drums of used raw engine oil among other goods worth ₹14 lakh.

396.title: Those responsible for sinkhole to face 'consequences': Chile
396.article_body: Chilean Mining Minister said that the country will apply sanctions on those responsible for a huge sinkhole near a copper mine. The sinkhole, 36.5 metres in diameter that opened in late July, triggered mobilisation of local authorities and suspension of operations by Canadian company Lundin. Fines tend to be insignificant, ruling must be exemplary to mining companies, Mining Minister added.

397.title: US-based firm Twilio suffers data breach after hackers trick staff via phishing attack
397.article_body: US-based cloud communications company Twilio said that hackers accessed its customer data after "fooling some employees into providing their credentials" via an SMS phishing attack. It said that the hackers used the stolen credentials to gain access to internal systems, following which they launched an investigation. Twilio has more than 1,50,000 corporate customers, including Airbnb and Uber.

398.title: Not just Haryana MLAs, those from Punjab, Delhi received threats too: Vij
398.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said that investigations have found that not just MLAs from Haryana but three legislators from Punjab and two from Delhi also received threat calls recently. Vij added that a special task force of Haryana Police arrested six people for allegedly making extortion calls to some MLAs of the state and also giving them death threats.

399.title: India should thank Mukesh Ambani for digitisation in the country: Jhunjhunwala
399.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has said that India should thank Mukesh Ambani for the change he has brought about in the country. "The low cost of communication, whether in voice or in data, has caused digitisation in India," Jhunjhunwala told CNBC-TV18 in an interview. "This country has to remain eternally grateful to Ambani," he added.

400.title: He apologises even if I lose a point: Sreeja Akula on Sharath Kamal
400.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula said CWG 2022 gold medallist and her mixed doubles partner Sharath Kamal apologises if she loses a point. 40-year-old Kamal trained in Chennai during the break due to COVID-19. "With the kind of routine we have had during CWG 2022, I would've been dead...two days ago (if it wasn't for improved fitness)," said Kamal.
